The rooms were very small but clean. Brochures talked about being remodeled, but it looked DIY as the paint job was power, but that did not effect the stay. Convenient location with easy access to foods and transportation. Most staff was friendly, but didn’t blow my socks off. Main advantage is that it was a quiet get away if you had a room to the courtyard... but maybe because the courtyard was basically closed due to construction.

I spent five nights at the 414 Hotel and I couldn’t have been happier. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. They gave us subway maps and umbrellas and it did rain most of the time we were there. The staff left a “flyer” under the door each morning with ideas of what to do, the cost of museums and the forecast… by hour. They even offered tours of the neighborhood as well as Central park. The morning breakfast was good, but best of all was a wonderful cappuccino machine which was complimentary and made a delicious cup of latte, espresso or cappuccino. The beds were comfortable and the location was perfect. You could walk just about anywhere. It was on a quiet street but only blocks away from Broadway and 42nd St. but you never ever knew you were that close to Times Square. It’s a smallish hotel that’s an actual brownstone that’s been converted and if you’re considering staying there, reserve now because they fill up quickly. That is a very good sign

What a great little hotel, not really like a hotel, it truly is like a home, which is what other reviews had said about it when I was looking to book a place to stay in New York. I looked at a lot of other places but something kept pulling me back to 414 Hotel and I'm so glad that I listened to my instincts. It made our holiday so much fun and relaxing. You could walk to anything and everything if you like walking and if not, there's lots of other ways to get around. The beds and pillows were great, this is really important to me when travelling. There are no lifts, so be prepared to walk up between 1-3 flights of stairs, wasn't a problem at all though and the staff were always happy to carry bags up and down stairs for you. Thank you to all the staff, especially Emmy (what a beautiful friendly girl) as was Ashley (who helped us in a very stressful situation and always with a smile).

not fancy but comfortable and clean. Staff is so very friendly and helpful. Generous continental breakfast and afternoon happy hour are a plus and a chance to visit with other guests. There were people there from several different countries. Will definitely stay at the 414 again.

The room was very comfortable and thoughtfully appointed. Small touches like a retractable clothesline would make this a great option for an extended stay. Another nice touch: minibar and snacks that were actually inexpensive: a convenience for guests, not a profit center. What was truly exceptional: the staff that treated us like family. We chatted with other guests in the dining area over a relaxed Continental breakfast, and found that everyone was having the same kind of positive experience. Can’t wait to return!

Our trip from Minnesota to New York during the weekend of a huge April snow storm which dumped 15 inches on St. Paul and shut down the airport for 5 hours making it impossible to arrive in New York that night. I called 414 Hotel to tell them and was impressed to be speak with such a warm and personable response; they made me feel like they were family anxiously waiting our arrival the next day. The storms delayed our arrival until late the following evening at 414 Hotel, but we found it well worth the trip! There was a welcoming, cozy fire going in a welcoming lobby highlighted with bright red accents. The front desk staff remembered we were the ones who didn't make it the day before and made us feel special as they asked about our trip. I was thrilled to then be shown to a wonderful, clean room that was cozy and had all the amenities I needed. The staff was knowledgeable about the area, and listed wonderful restaurants nearby which were still open and where we subsequently had a wonderful meal. They helped us plan how to efficiently get to our early morning destination the next day. I would highly recommend staying at 414 Hotel with a great location, super friendly and helpful staff, very clean and comfortable rooms. I was sorry we had to leave the next day, but I plan to return to spend more time there! Thank you to all the staff at 414 Hotel that made those two days of travel, which could have been difficult, so enjoyable!

The staff is so helpful and friendly. It is a family atmosphere. We go back every year, wouldn't stay anywhere else. Location is perfect for the shows on broadway and great access to the subway. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.

From the moment we arrived, we were treated like old friends. We were greeted by Emmy, who got us organised, made us drinks (even though it wasn't quite happy hour, yet), made sure our luggage was taken care of, and checked that we had reservations for dinner. Along with Jacquie, Ashleigh, and the rest of the staff, we were treated like royalty the entire stay, and we can honestly say so was every other guest. The special treatment we experienced extended even beyond this incredible staff. (Thank you, Ashleigh, for sending us to Dos Caminos and Jesus!)Happy Hour (hour and a half) and breakfast are great! We enjoyed talking with the other guests and meeting folks from all over the world.We felt safe in the neighbourhood, and our room was large, immaculate, well-serviced, and comfortable. Moreover, it was quiet, which was stunning given that we were not far from Times Square. We stayed on the 4th floor, and heat rises... but we could open the windows and it was still quiet. Amazing for NYC!Although there is no lift, we were helped with our luggage. And actually, having no lift is part of the charm and home-feeling of 414.We had access to really good restaurants, all walkable. The staff have a list of favourites and are happy to help with recommendations and reservations.We'll be recommending 414 Hotel to everyone we know. Go there. We'll be back the next time we're in NYC.

The staff were lovely, extremely friendly, personable and couldn't do enough for my sister and I during our visit, we got to the hotel well after happy hour but we were still given free drinks as soon as we arrived, they all made a point of learning the guests' names, and also helped my sister and I get a taxi when our ride to the airport failed to show up. The accommodation was great, the beds were comfy and everything was really clean; we visited in May, every day was hot and sunny so it was nice to come back to a cool room. Our favourite part of the hotel was the terrace at the back of the building, where we ate breakfast every morning and had our happy hour whiskeys every evening before going out. The breakfast was also awesome, with plenty to choose from. I'd absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York for the first time and would definitely stay here again!

A bit of a story. I have never been able to stay in New York City longer than 24 hours until this trip. You see, I have difficulty sleeping with a lot of ambient noise. On my one other previous trip to the City, I was on the 23rd floor of a prominent hotel on Times Square and it was a horrible experience with traffic noises and sirens all night. Also surprising to me, I found it very claustrophobic among the skyscrapers with only a thin strip of sky visible overhead. It ruined the City for me......... until now.414 Hotel is another rare example that goes into my “gets it right” column. First off, you should not expect the usual large lobby and big crowds usually found in big city hotels. This is a great example of a small, quaint European hotel translated into a rather suppisingly quiet area of Hell’s Kitchen in Manhattan. You CAN see the sky, in that the surrounding buildings are lower- not skyscrapers.At recept, you are warmly greeted by Jacque, he general manager and also will get to meet Ashley, the affable evening manager. They both exude a genuine concern for the comfort and enjoyability of your stay. The hotel was rendered from a tennament built in 1925. In there hotel information, they are upfront about the fact they have no elevator, but knowing this ahead of time they were able to accommodate me with a first floor roomThe rooms are neat and clean . Some thought has been put into the features of the room— for example, I have to use CPAP for sleeping and they have a plug-in station on the bedside table with multiple ports available. This avoids the usual moving of furniture and even the bed, I have had to undergo at some of the more expensive luxury hotels in which I have stayed in th past. Also, they have a modern bedside phone that incorporates an alarm clock and multiple charging extensions for most recent versions of electronics. Other amenities include flatscreen TV, fridge, a selection of snacks (for only a dollar each!), a small closet cabinet and tiled bath with complimentary toiletries which is CLEAN. A small selection of pastries, juices are available for a continental breakfast in the mornings and a wine and cheese social hour in the evenings compliments of the establishment.By the way, did I mention it was QUIET— I was able to take several naps and sleep at night with NO sirens, horns or traffic noises. Ah, what a refreshing change from my last visit! This hotel has opened up my ability to explore and enjoy this vibrant city.There are a few drawbacks— the room when I arrived was really hot, but this was remedied by cracking open the window which opens onto a small, enclosed rear courtyard. Also, the room was small, but what do you expect from a 1925 tenement.Overall, an A+ for attitude, environmental noise avoidance and a feeling of “at home” comfort. A really nice haven in the big city!

Wonderful, cozy boutique hotel ideally located in the city without the crush of people so common to the large hotel chain properties in the city. Comfortable, clean and wonderful service. My "go to" place when working in the city.

My daughter and I were lucky enough to stay at the 414. Along with the many sights and tastes in NYC, the 414 created an even more memorable experience. With a smaller boutique setting, the attentive staff provided a warm welcome and tips for exploring unique venues and "local" hotspots. The location couldn't be better with restaurants, entertainment and theatre galore. While dining in front of the fireplace we met couples from around the globe. It was truly a unique experience I will remember fondly.

I can understand that many guests like this hotel. It's well located and small scale, creating an atmosphere resembling an English B&B somewhat, which makes a change to all the boring hotelchains. And the staff are friendly and very helpful, eager to offer advice on restaurants and things to do. But does this make it one of the best hotels in NYC? I don't think so, unless hotel standards in NYC are much lower than in European or Asian cities. A hotel should first and foremost provide a good night's sleep, which was difficult due to the noisy neighbourhood(front room), uncomfortable bed and worst of all the inability to regulate room temperature efficiently. The hotel feels generally rather worn out and is very cheaply furnished and decorated. The breakfast is complimentary, but again lacking quality. Basically this place has potential, but needs a thorough makeover to justify the rates.

THe 414 hotel is a terrific boutique hotel in Manhattan. I stayed there when visiting family. It is convenient to restaurants, museums, theater, and of course the wonderful parks in NYC. I highly recommend it. Renee Goldberg, Worcester MA

I booked a four day trip to NYC to celebrate my husband's birthday. We prefer small, boutique inns and after reading some reviews the 414 Hotel sounded like a good fit for us.The staff is amazing! We arrived late afternoon and mentioned at check in we wanted to catch a play. Emmy and Jacqui suggested several close by restaurants for pre-show dining, both the most popular as well as a back up plan. By the time we had checked in, they had seamlessly provided our evening's entertainment!!!The Continental breakfast, as well as the evening wine and cheese are nice ways to meet other guests from around the world.Rooms were larger than most NYC rooms. Our room was in the back and very quiet. The hotel is located on a quiet street within easy walking distance of all the theatres, and surrounded by nice restaurants.Thank you to all the staff for help in making our celebration memorable. We hope to be back soon!

My wife and I spent 4 nights at this small and quaint hotel. We loved it. The rooms appear lived in- in a good way! They are comfortable and cozy- everything that you would need is available to you and the breakfast in the morning (included) is well above standard.No elevator might be an issue for some, but by day two we were both up and down with no issues. Staff was very helpful with anything we needed and offered great suggestions on new places to visit. We would definitely recommend this place to all.

Jacqui and Emmy along with the rest of the staff are outstanding people, knowledgeable and experienced. They made our 6 night stay memorable. The breakfast in the morning and happy hour in the afternoon with other guests from around the world is an added benefit. Definitely will return to 414!!

Came to NYC in the winter for some work with pleasure. The hotel is small, hommey style like a Zimmer in midtown NYC. Friendly, cousy place - if this what you are looking for. Nice BF in the small lobby/kitchen no eegs or any meat, just toast and cereals. The coffee is great. In the afternoon free happyhour with cheese and wine. The rooms are nice - good size. Location is a bit out - on 46 between 9 and 10th ave. - 15 min. Walk to most broadway shows. For people who are looking for something that is not a big hotel. In that case - i will say 5 stars. In my case I like the big hotels - it went to 4 stars, but still a great place.

The staff was friendly (They were very pleasant and responsive to my needs during my stay) drinks were great, great food, great location, nice design!!!!The bed was huge and one of the most comfy beds ive slept in.Coming back!

Wow! NYC from it’s best side. What a charming hotel. Compliment to 414. No need to say more: go and check out by yourself, you wan‘t be disappointed. In this Hotel you feel like you are in the heart of the heart of Manhattan!
user_name:
Michael B
New York City, New York

review_body: An absolutely gem! Everything was perfect, I don’t know, how it is possible to find such good people. I would stay there every time again. Really moderate good prices! Thank you for this wonderful stay - we are coming back!

It was absoulety perfect there I love staying there enjoying Everything is perfect over there Service is perfectly outstanding overall I can say that it's was my placeThank you for all for being so kind

We had never been to NYC. It was on my bucket list, so we planned a trip for my 50th birthday. After researching hotels for over 2 weeks, I found 414 Hotel on Trip Advisor! We loved it! It's a personable, charming, homey, amazing bed and breakfast type hotel. They greet you every morning when you get breakfast and coffee/tea in the lobby and every day when you return from your site seeing of the City. The rooms are clean, the bed and pillows were very comfortable, and linens were changed every day. It's two blocks from Times Square and a fifteen minute walk to Rockefeller Center. We highly recommend 414 Hotel! We will definitely stay there next time we go!

Lovely people, lovely hotelThe perfect location in town, close to everything especially theaters. Rooms very well kept, some smaller than others. I cannot say enough about how helpful and friendly the staff was. This made our stay so relaxing and comfortable, as they were always ready to help or answer questions. The breakfast food in the morning and wine/cheese in the evening were a wonderful touch. Would recommend to anyone looking for great staff, clean accommodations, and convenient location.

This place ROCKS!!! Best service and friendliest staff. Close to everything Time Square. The cost to stay is reasonable compared to hotels in this area. and the best of all The coffee service is over the top

The staff at the 414 Hotel was friendly and very helpful. They offered suggestions for entertainment, restaurants, and travel tips. The expanded breakfast was just what we wanted. Our room was spotless and equipped with the amenities we needed. The location of the hotel was ideal for theater and museum and close to transportation. We had a delightful stay.

This hotel is really a little gem! The staff is very friendly and helpful. It's about a block from Times Square on a quiet street. Tons of amazing restaurants within walking distance. The hotel offers continental breakfast and has a cozy fireplace and gathering area.

This was the third or fourth time we stayed here. Rooms are nice, very clean. Staff is excellent, very personable, really make you feel at home. Highly recommend this hotel. We have already made our reservations for next year same weekend.

The wonderful and helpful staff make this place a top 10 hotel in Manhattan. They are knowledgeable and have excellent food and entertainment recommendations. The hotel is not fancy but the rooms are decent size and the beds are good. Breakfast is included and a nice way to socialize with the other guests. There is also a happy hour with drinks and snacks. Internet is fast. If you are lucky you can also sign up for a personal walking tour of Central Park with Susan (the former owner). She is a warm and generous person. We will be back.

The location is great and the staff are exceptional, but beyond that this hotel fell far below my expectations. It definitely needs sprucing up. The radiator in the bathroom was rusty and broken. The vent in the shower was disgusting. The floor tile needs to to be seriously cleaned or re-grouted. The curtains in the bedroom are really old and stained. The room was 85 degrees when we arrived! We stayed right off of the courtyard (supposedly the quietest rooms are off of the courtyard) in room 205. The first night I was woken by someone or multiple people thumping around upstairs and this went on for hours! I finally called the front desk and complained. The noises did stop after that, but this was 3 AM at this point! We did not want to stay our second night, but we had to since we had pre-paid through Booking.com and our money would not be refunded. The second night I was awoken at 3:00 AM by an alarm that kept going off. I tried to call the front desk on my cell, but no one picked up. I couldn’t stand the noise so I went to the front desk in my pjs! The owner came back with me to investigate the noise. She determined it was not her building and called the police and eventually the alarm creased. In general, the walls are thin and the doors all close hard so you have to slam them...including the bathroom door. This hotel has potential as it has the makings to be quaint, but I don’t think there’s much they can do about the noise. I will not stay here again and will not recommend it to anyone...and FYI there is no Pay Per View!

We spent a week in NYC at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. It is conveniently located a block from Restaurant Row and a 10 minute walk from the Theatre District. The staff and particularly the owner were very welcoming and very helpful with suggestions on what to see and what was going on in the city. Our room, just off the cute interior courtyard, was quite comfortable and very quiet. There a 2 buildings, one behind the other connected by an outdoor courtyard. It was great to have breakfast included and the available options [cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, etc.] more than satisfied us. It was particularly nice to come back before dinner and to a small happy hour with wine and nibbles.

We spent 4 nights in Manhattan at the 414 Hotel in October 2017 just before our Silver Seas cruise to Montreal. The hotel was perfect. It’s close enough to walk to a lot of local attractions. Great restaurants and wine bars within walking distance. The staff is outstanding and very helpful. They can help with local attractions and directions and even offer discount coupons for many of them. We took the shuttle from NJ airport to the Hotel. Worked great and less than a taxi. We were able to walk to our port connection for the cruise. Guests from all over the world were staying at the hotel. Loved it.

We booked quite late for a Christmas visit so was unsure what we would end up with however for our first trip to NYC we could not have been happier. The hotel is less than 5 minutes walk to Times Square which is great for looking around and also getting to fifth avenue but also allows you to be in the middle of Hell’s Kitchen with all the bars and restaurants you could imagine, the hotel staff are extremely helpful with recommendations and information. We did not have breakfast during our stay as wanted to be up and out as soon as possible but was always full at breakfast time so shows it must have been good when there is so many options around. The cheese and wine is a lovely extra and allows for you to meet other guests or just have a quiet drink away from the madness. The stairs are steep and can be an effort after a day of walking around but as long as you’re aware it’s fine, we were on the top floor and the extra exercise helped us out after all the food and drink we had during our week! The rooms are basic but clean & tidy with a TV, the minibar is great cost compared to many other hotels/guesthouses! The shower is quite weak but as most people I’d assume would be there for a few days only, it’s more than adequate! We have so many friends and family who have visited New York and all have stayed higher end / in the middle of everything & from discussing it appears we definitely had a great place.I’d definitely recommend and look to return when we get back to visit!

We stayed in mid-December. The hotel is located at 9th Ave/46th Street(thus 414) in Hell's Kitchen. It is a great location! A block away from restaurant row; two blocks from the Theatre district. The staff is extraordinary. They were all very welcoming, knowledgeable and helpful. The lobby included a fireplace, afternoon wine, and cheese, chairs and tables, etc. Our room was clean and comfortable. It included a chair, chest of drawers, two side tables, and desk and chair. A reasonable sized room. The bathroom was very large with tub/shower combo and a single sink(wish there had been two). There was no wall art nor coffee pot in the room, although coffee, tea etc were all available in the lobby/dining room. A mini-fridge was included also. The rooms are accessed by stairs; no elevator. The stairs are somewhat narrow but we had no difficulty. We would definitely stay here again

This is NOT a Top Ten Hotel in NYC....the staff is superb, the location, fantastic. After that, it falls down quickly. This is a converted tenement building & you'll quickly realize that. The very steep stairs (13 steps per flight), the small, dismally decorated rooms, weak WIFI, low water pressure & low end amenities (half dollar size soap) will quickly disavow you of the notion that you landed a gem. The staff, on the other hand, are role model helpful, Jacqui in particular. The location is very central to Restaurant Row & Theater but with a neighborly feel, so in spite of our initial negative reaction (we're in a tenement room at top hotel end prices!) we decided to stay all 5 nights, even though at $400 per night all in, it was NOT a bargain! If you are looking for a stylish, comfortable, room & easy egress, this is NOT the place. If neighborhood feel & B&B friendliness is your biggest wish, try this, but it comes at a price!

We love this hotel! It is quiet, personal and very pleasant. One feels like they are visiting family when here! The staff is extremely helpful with all sorts of things going on, advice and are very up to date on shows, exhibitions, etc. Breakfast is very nice with an assortment of items that gets you started on the right food! Two doors down is a wonderful laundry service so you can return home with clean clothes! Finally, the hotel is very clean and cheery but it is not the Plaza. If glamour and glitz is what you are looking for, it is not here but for the price, this place is a delight!

This little cute and cozy hotel was perfect. Warm and friendly staff made our stay very welcome. Very close to restaurants and times square, but on a quiet street which was a great get away at the end of a long day of walking and shopping. Spacious room. Great job guys and thank you for a wonderful stay.

This our 5th or 6th visit to the 414 since 2014. Even though Susan and her husband have sold the place, their legacy still prevails. We saw a lot of the same faces with the same chipper smiles and willingness to please. The room was impeccable, breakfast was nourishing, and happy hour was a lot of fun with top-shelf liquor available. The location, just three blocks away from Times Square, a block away from Restaurant Row, and short walks from all the theaters makes the 414 the place to stay in midtown Manhattan. I heartily recommend it to anyone who wants a friendly, convenient place to stay in NYC. To the new owners, keep up the good work.

Patty and I joined friends who have stayed at 414 the past 10 years. It's more like staying at someone's house than a hotel. Everything was excellent and we have already booked a return trip for the summer.

This was our first stay at 414. It was recommended by friends. Wow, we could not have been happier. The cozy boutique hotel was not only spotless, the staff are incredible. They treat every guest like family. If you can get a room, grab it...you won't be disappointed.

The staff and guests we have met at the 414 make the stay fun and enjoyable every time. A few blocks from Times Square as well as the great restaurants and theater between 10th and 7th. Can't beat it.

We've just returned from our stay at hotel 414, what a great hotel, ideal location and extremely friendly staff. The social hour is a nice gesture where guests can meet up and talk about what they've been up to in the amazing city. Thank you for making our first time to New York so memorable

We just returned from another stay at the 414 Hotel. We absolutely love this quaint gem located close to everything we need in NYC! The staff is always incredibly helpful and we appreciate the opportunity to meet guests while we sit down for breakfast or at their lovely wine and cheese. We look forward going again soon!

This is lovely Hotel. Small, yet cozy with a personal touch. If you want glitz and luxury this is not the place for you. If you want the personal touch, mixing with staff and other guests, where nothing is too much trouble, where you are person not just a number, then this is the place for you. If I find myself back in New York I would return to this hotel.

We were not sure what to expect when we booked this hotel for a long weekend getaway with friends. From our first step through the door we were beyond impressed. This quaint placed tucked away on a not so busy street in Hell's Kitchen and blocks from Time Square and the theater district is a jewel! The staff were friendly and very accomodating with restaurant recommendations, directions and telling us about the "must see" for our weekend. We have stayed in botique hotels in Europe and this hotel ranks with the best of them.

This little hotel excels at personal service with a daily newsletter and personal recommendations from the staff. It’s location is perfect in midtown Manhattan. Nice amenities and a refreshing change from chain hotels. Be aware there is no elevator. But overall a great experience at the 414 Hotel.

My husband and I recently travelled to NYC for our honeymoon. I had spent a lot of time researching here to stay and had read the positive reviews for this hotel. I am so glad we stayed here. From the moment we arrived we were made feel welcome, it felt like staying with friends and family. Not only is the hotel a great location for visiting main sites, near restaurant row, it is the staff that set this hotel apart, Jacqui ,Emmie and apologies I forget the other names. They are what sets this hotel apart from others. They couldn't do enough for you from directions, recommendations on places to eat /stores to visit, we are comic book fans and Jacqui gave us some fantastic recommendations on where to visit for memorabilia, to making reservations and answering my endless questions. The rooms were clean- spacious for nyc. and location was great. Near enough to everything but away from the hustle and bustle. The happy hour was a great chance to enjoy some wine and cheese and meet other guests. I was genuinely sad to leave and we have never enjoyed staying in any hotel as much as this one. I will definitely be back and will only stay in the 414 hotel.

We enjoyed the warmth and charm of this place during our visit. In fact, when we'd return from our full day of exploring, walking, hustle and bustle, it was nice to come back in here where the fireplace was going and everyone was sitting around socializing with complimentary wine and cheese. The rooms are cozy, spacious enough and I can't praise Ashley at the front desk enough. She was very friendly, printed out subway directions multiple times and helped us get to the hotel and back beforehand. Short walking distance to Broadway, Rockefeller, Central Park and Times Square. For the price and service, would stay again in a heartbeat.

We've stayed here many times...and will continue to do so! 414 is so convenient, everyone is so friendly and helpful, and the amenities can't be beat at their price. From casual breakfasts to happy hour drinks and everything in between, we love this place! Try it once and you'll get hooked too.

Great place to stay! Stay is wonderful, rooms are clean and spacious. Very southern, home atmosphere. It’s a B&B type style hotel with only a few rooms. No elevators but worth the sacrifice. Staff was very helpful with what to do, and directions as well as which bus and subway to take. Guest from all over the world and the daily news letter was a nice personal touch. Will definitely stay here when we come back to New York.

This hotel offers reasonably nice accommodations, a nice breakfast, good housekeeping staff. No complaints! The biggest draw for us is the excellent location to theater district and restaurants so we don't have to take taxis. Front desk Staff on duty last month seemed a bit inexperienced, but probably tuned up by now.
user_name:
Steven G
Ellicott City, United States

review_body: Best place you can find in NY! Thank u Jacqui for the hospitality and I salute your staff. All so kind, informative, willing to help. Thanks for spoiling us for our anniversary. It felt like home. The great room, breakfasts, afternoon treats of wine and cheese selection ... we r back next year , and we can't wait to stay at your place once more

How do you start I booked 414 Hotel on the strength of the Trip Advisor reviews and it went above the expectations for this hotel you are treated so well by the staff from the moment we arrived it was our wedding anniversary trip there was a complementary bottle of fizz and chocolates in our room the hotel and room were spotless we booked the room off the Main Street we could not here any of the New York famous noise at night easy assess to Time Square about 6 minutes the staff have great knowledge of the city and are very helpful at all times loved the idea of the daily news letter on what is going on in the city breakfast was very tasty and coffee freshly brewed when you wanted it we will definitely use this hotel when we visit again thank you very much

This is a truly lovely small hotel for those who want a cozy, low key experience that makes you feel right at home. Jacqui, the manager, along with all the staff are wonderful, knowledgeable, and lovely. They could not be nicer. This is not the place for you if you want false glitz and a fancy environment. The rooms are small but nicely laid out. There are extra charging stations on both sides of the bed. There is not a desk and you need to turn sideways between wall and flat-screen TV, but this is NYC. Snacks are for your pleasure and not to make money at $1. Breakfast is excellent and the Jura espresso machine makes great coffee, espresso, and cappuccino. There is a happy hour at 5:30 with wine, beer, bourbon, rum, cheese. Lots of interesting guests. A daily info sheet and plenty of good recommendations for local restaurants. The location is great for Times Sq, Broadway plays, and so many restaurants. Would suggest Le Rivage and Empanada Mama. The owners must treat the staff well to have such good employees and housecleaners that have worked there for 15 years. We will definitely return to this excellent hotel.

Small Inn in a great location in Hell’s Kitchen. Really helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are quite adequate and comfortable. Wi-Fi, Happy Hour and Light breakfast are pluses. Community space small but cozy, court yard looks nice for warmer weather.
user_name:
Up69
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The 414 HOTEL is made from several old tenant buildings that have been restored beautifully as a homey boutique, bed-and-breakfast. Located in the residential area Of Hell’s Kitchen’s Restaurant Row, close to Broadway theatres and Times Square. This is a fabulous neighborhood. The rooms are small but well appointed, Wi-Fi, comfortable beds all the necessary bathroom amenities, a mini fridge with soda pops, and a few snacks should you get hungry. The hotel provides continental breakfast and a happy hour in the evening. The indoor public area is small but cozy. There is a lovely courtyard between the buildings. A neighbors construction has installed scaffolding covering courtyard and they are working weekdays. This should be completed in a few months, not a big deal. The staff is wonderful and know where to send you for everything. This is not a luxury hotel, no room service, gym etc. just a nice place to stay in NYC. I will be back.

Stayed 8 nights in the 414 and it was fantastic! The staff (Ashley, Emmy & Jacqui) were all super helpful and I couldn't recommend staying here enough. They were always interested in what we was doing and recommended where to go and things to see, we will be back as it is the only place to stay! Nice size rooms, breakfast and happy hour, even the odd cheeky wine when we returned at 9/10pm :-). Thank you all.

very close to theaters. Wonderful staff, very fun speaking with them about the hotel's history and back ground on Hell's Kitchen. Room was not particularly fancy, but very comfortable. Nice social happy hour in the evening with beer+wine.

Good location on uws near theater district. Walk up with good sized rooms. Very nice breakfast. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Will help with luggage if challenging without an elevator. Stayed there multiple times. Attracts international crowd.

Wow, what a great hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The layout of the hotel (and free happy hour) promotes conversation with other guests. Will definitely stay here again. I suggest booking early if you want to stay on a weekend, as it is a popular hotel.

Wonderful stay, super comfortable beds. Check in was simple and easy. Staff was friendly and accommodating. My boyfriend and I were in the city for the first time and the front desk was very helpful. Would definitely stay here again

As a huge believer in TA, I spent hours trying to find the right hotel for my husband & my trip to NYC. When I discovered an opening at the 414 and read the reviews, I knew it was the one for us. We easily drove in and found parking in the parking garage one street over, and the hotel validated the ticket for a discount. I knew we were early but left our bags and the woman at the desk offered lunch recommendations and even to make us an espresso to go! We were happy with our decision right off the bat.After walking the city up and down we did not leave time to enjoy the wine and cheese. We came back to the hotel to see others enjoying it by the fire. Next time we will, too! Our show was just one block over (right in the middle of Restaurant Row), and Times Square and the closest subway station were nearby as well. Great location.Our room was spotless and quite large with nice sheets. The bed was a bit hard for my taste (personal preference) and the shower water pressure a bit low (fourth floor) but otherwise the room was lovely. Breakfast was a treat as well. Plenty of choices in a warm, friendly atmosphere. Although I consider myself somewhat shy, I really enjoyed visiting with the other guests rather than everyone staring at their phones, as is so often the case these days.We really enjoyed this hotel and I will certainly visit again the next time I am in town with my husband or my mom--she will love it too.

I have reviewed the 414 Hotel in the past, but after a recent visit in early November I am compelled to do so again. Given the choice, I will never stay anywhere in NYC again. The 414 has so many positive attributes it's hard to know where to begin. It is ideally located, and managed by a professional and engaging staff, all of whom are willing to do anything to enhance a quest's visit. The hotel is more like a B and B, with a filling breakfast, social hour, and courtyard. Moreover, it is extremely quiet for being only minutes away from Times Square, and the beds are wonderful. After a busy day in the City, the return to the 414 is as almost as welcoming as arriving home at your own house.

Loved all the great perks of this hotel! My favorites are the daily news, the breakfast and coffee in the morning, the directions, Hell's Kitchen right there, Restaurant Row within a block, 5 minute walk to the Shake Shack and Broadway. Hospitality was the best at the 414!!! Won't stay anywhere else but there from now on.

If we return to NYC we will stay at 414. The feel is that of a bed and breakfast. All the staff were friendly and the service was excellent. Jacqui was so welcoming and her recommendations for food and activities were all perfect. (Juniors does have the best cheesecake) In the lobby there is an area 5 small tables and 1 large table where a continental breakfast is served and then from about 5;30 - 7:00 beer, wine and cheese are provided. We loved the experience of starting the day and then in the evening interacting with other guests, and staff, while we planned the day or evening. I believe one evening we chatted with other quests enjoying wine far past 7:00 (I think 9:00?) The hotel is a few blocks from Times Square and the Theatre District. This was our first trip to NYC and we are so pleased we decided to stay here.

With lovely management and team. Everything is done to make guest feel welcome and create contacts among them and with the hotel team. Very quiet also especially in the rooms on the yard. Just that the nearest subway station is a bit far away. We recommend strongly 414 Hotel

Wonderfully friendly hotel, full of personality and extremely comfortable. Very near everything, especially Times Square and staying there you really feel part of New York. My son had the best haircut at a local barber. The other lovely thing is that your stay is enhanced by all the guests you chat to over breakfast, you start your day very happy. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel but particularly the staff. From the minute you walk in you feel as if this is a home from home and the staff will do everything to make your stay a special occasion, the newsletter every morning, the vouchers for the sites, tips about shopping, great restaurant and bar suggestions (Don't Tell Mama is a must), you get all that and more. The location is superb, a few minutes from restaurant row and then to Times Square but in a quiet street that feels like a refuge from the hustle and bustle. The warmth from the staff means that breakfast and the free cheese and wine happy hour are a joy with guests from all over the world chatting away. The rooms are clean and the beds very comfortable and the drinks in the room are a great price and not the usual hotel rip-off. I'll never staff in a chain hotel in NY, it will be 414 for me every time.

Amazing little hotel. Great location, lovely rooms and friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever come across in a hotel. Helped us with subway travel, gave us maps and even gave us a discount code for money off a broadway show to save us queuing in Times Square at the booth. The complimentary breakfast and wine and cheese hour meant we had the opportunity to meet some great people from all over the world. Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NY.
user_name:
Jill D
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed at 414 for 7 nights and were provided with excellent service the entire time.This was our home base for our daily walking excursions but it really felt like Home by the time we left.The Staff are great, offering endless amounts of information & good recommendations on every aspect of our trip.Location was great too...10-15 minutes to most theatres & Times Square.Thanks to Ashley, Emmy, Jackie and all the rest at 414. I would recommend this to anyone.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel 414. Excellent location just steps from Times Square and great restaurant choices on 9th Avenue, also known as Restaurant Row. Hotel 414 is part hotel, part B&B. Actually it's more like staying with family and friends. The staff were sincerely kind and very helpful. The communal breakfasts and Happy Hours were fun and a great time to get to engage with the staff and other guests. Our arrival to the hotel was an easy walk with our bags from the Hudson and 48th Street cruise ship port and to the musical we attended on West 45th Street! Our room (#104) is at the back bottom floor of the hotel and provided exceptional quiet in the heart of Manhattan. Hotel 414 is very clean, offers comfortable beds, kind welcoming staff, healthy breakfast options and a happy hour in a quiet central location in Manhattan. Who could ask for more? Highly recommended! We look forward to seeing Susan and her staff again soon.

414 Hotel is a very nice mixture of hotel and guest house. The staff couldn't be more welcoming and full of helpful advice. The breakfasts are taken communally and its a very pleasant way to start the day. The location is quiet but very near Broadway and the theatres. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. 414 Hotel was a very good base for our stay in New York.

Fantastic place with the best staff! Located on W 46 St between 9th & 10th Ave, perfect location whilst offering a quiet retreat from the Manhattan madness! Room was lovely & very comfortable. Special occasion for our visit & the staff arranged prosecco & chocolates in the room.. lovely surprise!The staff are amazing.. Emmy, Jackie & Andrea.. full of great recommendations, advice & offers and always happy to chat about what you’ve done that day & plans for the following day. Similarly the other guests were very friendly & enjoyed their company whilst enjoying the 5.30-7pm happy hour with complimentary wine, beer, whisky & cheese! Superb! Thanks again for having us & we’ll definitely be back next time we’re in NYC! Keep doing what you’re doing! Cheers, Alex & Julie (Manchester, UK)

Going with my 10 year old son, the location and athmosphere in this hotel is perfect. Short way to all activities and city larm, and a restful place to come home to when feets are tired. The staff is amazingly personal, caring and helpful. Getting free tickets to pop-up events you thought would be fun for us, getting discounts and good suggestions for food and activities. Thank you for all your hospitality and making this trip extra special! We will come back!

Hotel 414 met our needs perfectly. Our room was clean and comfortable with nice bedding and sparkling bathroom. We liked the minimalistic design and especially the low rise building. The Staff knew exactly how to be attentive and helpful. Susan was amazing with just the right amount of enthusiasm andInformation. Breakfast was so not generic with fresh everything. I love it there and can’t wait to go back.

The 414 Hotel separates itself from the competition by a multitude of factors. Superb local restaurant and bar recommendations, real high quality beds to help sleep, very personable staff actually interested in your trip, great continental breakfast with gorgeous doughy bagels and eggs and a 5:30-7pm cheese wine, beer, whiskey that brings all the guests together encouraging great camaraderie.

Very nice stay at the 414 hotel. For us, the rating is between very good and excellent.The service was quite perfect. The room (courtyard) was comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent to visit the different areas of Manhattan and for restaurants in the evening. The hosts were very attentive to all our requests and were excellent guides to visit the city. The happy hours were very appreciated. May be, a small pastry may be added for the breakfast.

We ate breakfast every morning on the best little back porch and truly felt that the staff WANTED us to enjoy ourselves. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was bigger than any bathroom I have ever seen in other nyc hotels. We will definitely stay there again in 2 years when we return to our “happy place”!

Terrific little inn. Wonderful location on restaurant row and within walking distance of theaters. Staff is knowledgeable and very helpful. Buffet breakfast and treats throughout the day are lovely touches. This is a treasure.

Rooms are clean and comfortable. Front desk staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about local restaurants and attractions. The evening social hour is a great opportunity to chat with other guests. A few blocks from Time Square. Gotham Market is a few blocks in the other direction and a great spot for a quick meal, beer and ice cream. We will be back when we get to NYC again. Thanks!

414 welcomed, served and checked on us like we were family visiting for the weekend.Their customer service, hospitality and friendliness is off the "outstanding" chart. The evening happy hour and morning continental breakfast offerings were generous, unlimited and delicious. Consequently, the guests were also friendly and everyone enjoyed the camaraderie of new friends from all over the world. I appreciated the attention to detail regarding security. Our room was clean, average in size with simple decor. The location was very convenient to our favorite attractions and new places.

Took my mom to NYC for 4 days/3 nights, and stayed at the 414 Hotel. Our room was very comfortable--we stayed in the Classic Queen Room on the first level. We have never encountered such a friendly and accommodating staff--Susan even went to the trouble to get some fat-free milk for my mom when she discovered they didn't have any at the time, and Jackie was very helpful in suggesting several places to enjoy a late-afternoon rooftop drink. It was also helpful to get advice and suggestions on things to do, or best ways to reach certain destinations. The wine and cheese reception was wonderful, too; we became acquainted with several of the other travelers, and enjoyed our conversations with them, and getting that bite to eat before the Broadway shows enabled us to eat dinner after the shows. The location is perfect, too. Walking distance to Restaurant Row, theaters, Central Park,Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and public transportation. I highly recommend this hotel--it definitely feels like home!

Having read numerous reviews on this hotel we booked 3 nights following a wedding in Connecticut. This hotel meets all the expectations of the previous reviews and deserves its place at the top of the rankings mainly because of the quality of staff who are the most helpful and friendly bunch you could hope to meet. Their suggestions for things to do and places to eat were excellent and the rooms comfortable and clean.An issue with our luggage at the end of our trip was sorted out with professionalism beyond the call of duty. Would certainly go back to this hotel next time in N Y.The neighbourhood is lively and fun and the little extras offered by the hotel were fantastic. Keep up the good work Susan, hope to meet again one day?John and Sue

Homely, personable, cosy. We stayed in the king bed room in the basement level, plenty of room and bathroom good. We felt safe and secure especially coming back one night at 1am, there was someone to meet us and let us in. The communal breakfast was great to meet and greet other guests staying at the hotel and the staff were very willing to give advice and help at any time. Thanks guys for a lovely three night stay.

Just laughed at myself after writing the title....this was my first trip to NYC so I have no experience staying in other hotels. But, I have no interest in staying anywhere else on return trips! The 414 truly made our trip. Susan and staff were very gracious and welcoming. Jacqui became our go to person. The hotel location was perfect. Breakfast was simple yet perfect after eating at the many nearby restaurants in the evenings. Happy hour is best spent on the front porch! We enjoyed the energy and intensity of the city, but found that the 414 provided us with an oasis of peace and quiet after a busy day. Highly highly recommend!

I'm 72 and limited in doing this kind of technology, but I had to try! Best place, best location and again, everyone who works here is friendly and helpful! , Stayed twice and will definetly stay a third time!

My wife and I spent 4 nights at the 414, and couldn't have been happier with the room and the service we received. Our room was quiet and comfortable and looked out over a beautiful courtyard; it was hard to believe we were only a few minutes from Times Square and the Theatre District. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Daily Happy Hour, a chance to visit with other guests from around the world, is not to be missed! My wife and will someday return to New York and I can't imagine us staying anywhere else.

From the moment we entered the front door until our departure a week later, 414 met every need and exceeded expectations.The owner and management team are exceptional - they were ready to assist where needed to ensure we maximized our visit to NYC.Our comfortable, beautiful room was thoroughly cleaned each day by wonderful staff.Breakfast was great - easy and feels like you're at home.Daily happy hour drinks and snacks is a real bonus, offering an opportunity to share stories and experiences with other guests before heading out for the evening.Great location with easy access to everything that made our trip what we wanted it to be. For our visit to New York, this was a wonderful choice.The team at 414 Hotel have a winning recipe at this boutique establishment - we will definitely make this our first choice for accommodation next time we are in NYC.

We really loved staying here. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. There was a breakfast buffet every morning and a happy hour every afternoon. The staff is very helpful and attentive. The neighborhood is full of restaurants of every kind. Would definitely stay again.

This was a nice surprise. It is a small hotel with plenty of good things. Nice clean rooms, continental breakfast and happy hour. Ideal location for theater and walking anywhere-2 blocks to time square and 2 blocks (the other way to the river) The staff was wonderful(something you never get in the big hotels) We are looking forward to another visit.

414 truly made our stay in NYC much more enjoyable than if we had stayed at a regular big name hotel. The staff was so warm and friendly, always willing to help us with questions about places we wanted to visit, printing our vouchers and boarding passes, & being sure all of our needs were met. 414 provided breakfast and “Happy Hour.” It was so much fun to sit at the long table with other guests during this time, and compare experiences of each other’s day, talk about one another’s travel experiences, and become friends! If you wish to stay at a hotel in a great location, with clean rooms & reasonable pricing, and enjoy a fun, family atmosphere, this is the place for you!

We came to New York to see a couple Broadway shows and be 'tourists' and couldn't have found a better place to stay. The owner Susan, and her amazing and welcoming staff (Jacqui and Drew) made our stay so unique, memorable, personable, and special - thank you. Susan helped us planned our days and navigate the city of New York - amazing. Mornings were filled with a lovely breakfast and fine coffee while sitting in their little bistro, taking in the sights and sounds of the city - so great. This is a must if you are travelling to New York - super close to airports and subways. We can't wait for our next visit.

The 414 Hotel is no doubt the BEST hotel that makes you feel like home. The entire staff has that same family spirit and treats each and every customer with undivided attention and courtesy. Rooms are very clean, breakfast and happy hour with wine and cheese are served in a friendly atmosphere. Thank you for such an amazing stay at your hotel!

Every review was exactly as we found the 414. Except for the one about dirty rooms and worn carpets and bad neighborhood. That review was a mistake, that reviewer obviously confused the 414 with another hotel. We are so pleased to have found a boutique BandB hotel in NYC. We stayed 4 nights. Went to the theater, walking, 3 times and had late dinners in the neighborhood on "restaurant row". Used the very closeby subway to attend 2 food tours. All of this we did on our own but we noticed that Susan was readily available to help anyone. It seemed that they went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. Loved Susan and her staff, felt as though we were visiting old friends.

This place was perfect.. all the reviews we read were spot on. The 414 was very clean, comfortable, personal, friendly and helpful. The room was perfect, nothing extravagant, but very clean and comfortable. Ours faced the main street but noise was never an issue. Loved the newsletter every day and the morning breakfast and coffee. ALL the staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially at explaining the subway system..haha.. We plan to come back with some friends and we will definitely stay here again.

Everything written about the gracious staff is true and more. Never in this city have we experienced such personal service and attention. Susan has assembled an amazing group of warm, authentic and interesting people to greet and care for any and every need without being intrusive in any way. The description of the accommodations is absolutely accurate so if you desire a large spacious and modern hotel, this is not for you. We loved our smaller first floor room for it's convenience and our itinerary took us out most of the time. Susan rearranged this for us due to a last minute leg issue!But the front stoop, courtyard and entry gave us a place to spread out if needed. We are in this city often and were so happy to return to this spot to really unwind and feel comfortable after a busy day. We will return and appreciate knowing we can relax in NYC as well as sight see.

The 414 hotel met all of our needs and more. Not only was it clean and quiet (courtyard room on the 4th level) it was good value. The service was exceptional. Very personal and informative with excellent recommendations. A big shout out to Susan and her team. They went above and beyond to make our stay awesome.

My husband and I came to NY to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. This was our first trip to the city in over 10 years and our very first time experiencing the city together so I was looking for a nice central location that would allow us to do the typical touristy things as well as experience great food and get a bit of a feel for what it was like to live like a New Yorker. I spend a lot of time researching where to stay so the positive reviews on Trip Advisor were a big part of why I selected this hotel and I can now say from first hand experience, all the accolades are well deserved. From the moment we walked through the welcoming red door, this hotel exceeded all my expectations. We felt like all the staff genuinely cared about all the guests and sincerely wanted them to have the best experience possible. Here are some of the highlights for us.HOTEL: The building is a cute NYC walkup, the typical tenement style building you see in the movies that makes you feel more like you are staying at a friend's apartment than a typical hotel. If you are looking for your typical Marriott or Hilton feel, this is not the place for you. Our room was on the 3rd floor of the main building and required a climb up 3 flights of stairs but that just added to the experience for me. The cheery red and white awnings and benches in the small entry courtyard are a welcome sight after a day of exploring the city. The main floor has a large table and a few small ones to take your breakfast or enjoy the evening happy hour. There is also a nice courtyard between the 2 buildings. The small kitchen off the lobby is accessible all day with a coffee machine that makes fantastic drinks as well as a microwave to heat up an occasional leftover. ROOM: Our room was a premium queen facing the courtyard on the 3rd floor. It was clean and quiet, nothing fancy. I appreciated having a small refrigerator in the room and dual nightstands at the bed with plenty of outlets for charging phones, etc. There was a large wall mounted television which we did not use and a wall mounted air conditioner which was working hard as it was an extremely warm week in NYC. Our bathroom had bath/ sink/ toilet all in one, not with the sink outside as I've seen mentioned in a few reviews. An additional shelf/ counter space in the bathroom would have been helpful but we appreciated the nice thick towels and eco friendly toiletries. AMMENITIES: As mentioned, there is a breakfast put out each morning. There are bagels, pastries, yogurt as well as cereal and fruit. In the evening, there is wine and brandy as well as an assortment of cheese and crackers set out to encourage more gathering. These joint social hours, combined with the friendliness of the staff, seem to set the tone for an open, family like environment between everyone. We met many fellow guests and enjoyed hearing about where they were from and what they were up to in the city. In addition to these perks, there is a daily newsletter put out for guests with weather forecasts and helpful ideas for how to spend the day. We took advantage of the free library tour and the free Friday night at MOMA, both of these suggestions were featured in our daily letter. We also made use of the complimentary umbrellas on a rainy morning. There is a selection of travel books and brochures in the lobby to help plan your day as well as a two page printout handed out at checkin with local dining recommendations. I found this to be very helpful as the number of dining choices in the area are almost overwhelming. Our favorite from the list was Pio Pio. We also tried a Brazilian restaurant, Samba, just around the corner from the hotel that wasn't featured on the hotel's list but was excellent. STAFF: This is where the hotel truly shines. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the warm and friendly Drew, who checked us in. We were tired from a day of travel and a little frazzled from a lost luggage problem and he wisely suggested a close by and delicious Thai restaurant for a quick bite that night. He always had a big smile and a friendly greeting for us each day and we looked forward to seeing him in between running off to our New York adventures. I also appreciated that upon entering our room that evening, we were welcomed with chocolates, champagne and a handwritten card from Susan, the hotel manager, wishing us 'Happy Anniversary'. Jacqui and Susan were there to welcome everyone in the morning and were both so hands on with all their guests. On our first morning, we opted to eat our breakfast outside on the bench overlooking the street and Susan promptly had a table brought out for us to eat over. Jacqui graciously provided me with some coupons for shopping as I needed to get a few things while waiting on my lost suitcase as well as some tips on where to get some basics in the area. As another example of their personal touch, my husband and I got caught in a rainstorm during a run in Central Park one morning. The hotel called our room upon our return, offering their dryer for our wet clothes.Finally I should mention how helpful Rachel was upon leaving. She arranged a car service for us to JFK and even made me a cappucinno in a 'to go' cup to take on the drive. I have never felt so cared for by the staff of a hotel. Customer service sometimes seems like a lost art but this hotel gets it and it never feels forced or insincere. Just great people who excel in their industry and seem to love what they do. LOCATION: This hotel is in a fantastic location for sightseeing but it's also ideal if you are a runner! It is less than a mile to the Hudson River greenway or Central Park, both places offer some of the best running in the city without having to dodge traffic. We were also pleasantly surprised by how much walking we did to get around as SO many things were around a mile or so from the hotel that it was just easier to walk there. We walked to Broadway shows, Grand Central, Bryant Park, New York Public Library, High Line, Central Park, Lincoln Center, MOMA and Empire State Building. At no time, either on the subways or walking back to the hotel late at night, did we ever feel unsafe. The area definitely has a more quiet, residential feel then Times Square but that is exactly what we enjoyed the most. I really fell in love with the city this trip and I think where we chose to stay was a big reason for that. Thank you so much, Susan and staff for making our 20th anniversary so memorable.Sincerely,Nicole and Jon in AZ

Hotel 414 was fantastic, it really did feel like a home from home. All the staff are so friendly and helpful, even the other guests were great. The hotel is not luxury, you might even say it is basic, but everything is immaculate, spotlessly clean and you get everything you will need for a New York break. (There are even fold up umbrellas for guests)The location is great, Times Square, restaurant row and all the Broadway shows are on your doorstep and the subway is just two blocks walk. A daily newsletter gives some great ideas and money saving tips for activities in New York. All I can do is repeat the other great reviews, breakfast and happy hour are great. Both are very much a case of help your self and sit where you want/can and this is where you get talking to the other guests. Being from the England we had many an enlightening account the US political system and lots of opinions regarding a certain Mr Trump. Special thanks go to Susan, Emmy and Drew for being so welcoming and helpful. In short, we had a great time and will definitely stay at 414 again if ever we are in New York.

My husband and I stayed here from Thursday night until Sunday afternoon. Susan and the staff - including Drew and the lovely Rachel- treated us so well, and our room was very nice, even worth walking up four flights of stairs! The location was perfect. We walked to our show at Radio City Music Hall to see Dave Chappelle and Trevor Noah, and to see Come From Away the next afternoon. Lots of great restaurants and nightlife. We had a great time, and would come back here again.

Not sure where to start....very dangers location, my wife and I were terrified walking back to the hotel after the shows were over. Room was dirty, torn carpet, leaking faucet and noisy air conditioner.Owner so called hidden gem recommendation were all within two blocks of the hotel??I asked her about that and she said (trying to help out the neighborhood) instead of truly recommending what is good...We had dinner at one of the restaurants recommended and it was absolutely a disaster. Perhaps the worst meal we have ever had in NYC.Staff were so rude with the exception of two people and the were both new to the hotel. Figure this one out.We stayed there because of the reviews and I'm starting to wonder who are these people and what other hotel experience that they have.Prices are high for what you get, we paid another $120/night and we were able to stay one block from Central Park in a true 5 stars hotel.I wish someone had wrote this review before so I would have never experience it myself.

Excellent location between 9th and 10th Ave, but on a fairly quite street. Very nice room, which has really tall ceilings and is surprising big for NYC. Helpful and super-friendly staff. Enjoyed the daily guest newsletter they leave at the door. Nice continental breakfast that reminds me of the hotels in Europe. I want this place to be first on my list for NYC visits in the future.

Yes, it's possible to find a cosy hotel, without street noise, at two steps from Times Square.Our room, on the backyard, was very spacious and comfortable.The buffet of breakfast was delicious, happy our too.So we had one very nice week in NY.Thank you to Susan, Drew, and all the staff for their professionalism and kindness!Beatrice and Arnaud

My wife and I, and our close friends spent two nights at the 414 Hotel this week. We came to NY to enjoy Broadway plays, so we wanted accommodations within walking distance of the theatres and close to good places to eat. 414 Hotel met these requirements perfectly.From my first contact with Drew who took my reservation over the phone to check-out, we were treated by the staff with courtesy and consideration. The hotel has 22 rooms and caters to an international clientele; it is an intimate place, and we were delighted to meet people from different countries over the plentiful breakfast which is included in the very reasonable rate.Our room was spotlessly clean; we had control of the AC; there was no traffic noise, either in our room or our friends'; the complimentary WiFi was a plus. Our friends who had previously stayed in the big, touristy hotels in the Theater District, now will choose 414 Hotel for future visits, as will we.I suggest making reservations early. If you're driving, the hotel management has arranged a special rate at a parking garage just around the corner. Weather permitting, you will enjoy breakfast in the delightful courtyard.In conclusion, we had a wonderful stay at 414, and we know you will, too.

We came back to NYC recently and returned to our "home away from home" the 414 Hotel.It reminds me of so many of the charming boutique hotels we have stayed in Europe. This may be why when we are at the 414 we hear other guests speaking in French, German, etc. It just adds to the experience. We enjoy everything about this hotel. The staff could not be more helpful or friendly. The breakfast which is complimentary is perfect. The coffee is better than at a coffee shop and they have specialty coffee machine too (also complimentary). We often weren't around at the cocktail hour, but if you are, enjoy that too. We had wine, cheeses and there were some spirits too. Yes, complimentary! Our room, a Premier Queen in the back building was again comfortable and we slept well. It was peaceful and overlooking the charming courtyard. If you stay here, you will never be a stranger in New York again. That is why we enjoyed going back. Love,love being at the 414 hotel! Thank you Susan and all the lovely staff for making our visit so nice!

Well, home from our holiday in New York and what can you say that has not already been said about our awesome accommodation in the neighbourhood of Hell’s Kitchen on tree lined West 46th Street, the 414 Hotel.Susan and all her friendly staff, including housekeeping, are absolutely wonderful. From the moment you check in you are made to feel so welcome! The accommodations are clean and spacious with a large bathroom. My wife and I were fortunate for our 12 night stay to have a quiet room on the 4th floor in the back townhouse overlooking the outdoor brick courtyard where guests can sit and relax and enjoy the cheese and wine “happy hour” at the end of every day from 5.00pm. There are also benches out front where you can sit and watch daily life in New York walk by.Wireless internet, the Continental breakfast and all day tea and coffee are included adding to the value of your stay.Getting to know other guests from around the world and listening to their adventures are made so easy in the environment of this hotel. You may also pick up some tips for your own experience from a guest, as we did with a tip on using Detour, a guided walking tour app we used in Central Park and Greenwich Village! The knowledge Susan and her team have of New York is second to none and all are happy to lend advice on making your way around New York or on activities that are suited to your own agenda, such as the best Subway train to catch to a Yankees game, the best place to get pizza, theatre tickets, or which bus to catch for a day trip to Philadelphia. All in all staying at this hotel made our holiday in New York such a great overall experience. Being in walking distance to restaurant row, the theatre district, Times Square, the Subway, you name it you can get to it easy from this location.Thank you once again Susan and team, it was an absolute pleasure for Jo and I to have been guests at your charming hotel.

If you're coming in from Newark via Penn Station, it's very handy. Not in the immediate neighbourhood but a good walk up 9th Avenue, which has a lot of places for quick bites etc. Staff at the 414 are fantastic and welcoming. It's in a residential stretch of W46th which is tree lined and quiet. Quick walks to subway stations at Port Authority Bus Terminal or W50th street.

If you are going to stay in NYC, do yourself a favour and stay at the 414 hotel. Only a couple blocks away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, the neighbourhood it is in of Hells Kitchen is awesome, with restaurants galore, a really cool vibe and close to a number of different subway lines. The hotel itself is also great, from the rooms which are spacious and comfortable with all the mod cons, to the daily breakfast and evening wine and cheese that make your stay extra enjoyable. The team at 414 are all incredibly friendly, and they also went above and beyond to organise a nice little gift for my wife who celebrated her birthday while in NYC.I would definitely recommend staying at 414 if you get an opportunity to!

My husband & I stayed here in July for 3 nights when in New York for the Classic East concert & our anniversary - it was my second time to NYC & my husbands first :) Fantastic little hotel tucked away on a quiet street just off 9th. Close to everything :) Very cozy , friendly & it included wine/cheese 4:30-7pm , beautiful breakfast , expresso machine available all day for hot beverages. Staff were wonderful & even left us a bottle of champagne with chocolates when we mentioned that morning that it was our anniversary ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️My husband loved that we could sit in the little outdoor courtyard & out front on bench in am with our coffee. Rooms were nicely decorated & very clean. I have stayed in a large hotel in time square & definitely preferred this smaller , more intimate hotel. We had a car & parking was directly around corner on 47th - very convenient. We will definitely be back 414 ❤️

Great, warm staff. Luxurious accommodations. I adore this place. Will return. You get what you pay for.Included are wifi, continental breakfast, and a happy hour. The premium queen is replete with amenities. I'm happy as a clam at high tide.

The location of this hotel is terrific for those who want to attend a Broadway or off-Broadway play - just a few blocks to Times Square and all its glitter and to many theaters. The neighborhood abounds with dozens of restaurants, both large and small, of every imaginable type of cuisine. The hotel has the most welcoming and friendly staff that my wife and I have ever encountered in our travels. Jacqui, Susan (the manager) and Drew were all very friendly and welcoming every time we came back "home" from sightseeing or seeing a play. Jacqui and Susan were particularly helpful and knowledgeable and gave us numerous suggestions of restaurants and other things to do both before we arrived and once we were guests at the hotel. They even give their clients a daily bulletin detailing things to do and places to go, including money saving tips for many of the suggestions. Each afternoon at 5 or so, the staff puts out wine and cheese (and some very fine single-malt Scotches and single-barrel Bourbons, I might add) for their guests. Many of the guests are from other countries, and the wine and cheese party gives everyone the opportunity to get to know each other better. There is also a small courtyard, which is a very pleasant place to have the hotel-provided continental breakfast, to savor your wine and cheese, and to just chat with the other very interesting travelers. The rooms are simple and small (as one would expect in a European-style hotel in NYC), and the beds are queen-sized, but the room and the bathroom were very clean and surprisingly quiet. We expect to return often. Thank you Jacqui, Drew, Susan and the rest of the staff.

Susan and others at Hotel 414 provide a friendly and welcoming environment where guests feel instantly at home. Excellent location two minutes from Times Square. Comfortable bed, and all necessary emenities; breakfasts included. Staff are knowledgable about attractions, transport etc. and helpful with bookings etc.;metro cards available. Great ambiance and family-feel makes interaction with other guests easy. Highly recommended. We would return there in an instant.

Stayed here for one week at the end of July. It's in a great location. So close to Times Square and the shows at broadway. The staff are all fantastic. So helpful at advising us on our best options for travel arrangements. We'll be back staying here the next time we visit this great city. Thanks very much for all you've done.

Staff so friendly and helpful. Room at the front was quiet and clean with double glazing. They were comfortable but standard in their appearance.Great location away from Times Square and plenty of restaurants within walking distance.Would recommend a Mexican nearby which has BYO. List provided by Hotel.All good Recommend.

414 Hotel was an amazing place to stay in NYC. Close to all the action at Times Square/Theater District, but just off the beaten track enough to provide quiet and relaxation. Susan, Jacqui, Rachel and the rest of the staff we met were unbelievably friendly, helpful and added so much of our visit. Daily breakfast and happy hour provided additional time to talk to others about things to do or compare notes on things done.  Would definitely go back next time I'm in New York.

We booked here for our stay to see a Broadway show and the sights. Very convenient to the theatre district, many restaurants, and near Times square as well. Nearest subway stop is 5 minutes walk. The hotel itself is great, tucked between main streets so very quiet, good security with locked door and staff onsite 24/7. A nice courtyard between the buildings to sit and enjoy. Good breakfast and a wine and cheese session in the afternoon. Susan and her staff are excellent, daily newsletters and tips and advice on anything you need from subway routes to places to see and eat. We really enjoyed our stay

I gave this hotel 5 stars because 10 was not an option. My husband and I stayed here and absolutely loved it. Susan and her staff are very welcoming and strive to give each guest a top notch NYC experience. This is a very cozy hotel, rooms are comfortable. Very small and intimate much like a bed and breakfast. Very secure, hotel personnel on site 24/7. No elevator, but staff took our luggage up to our room before we were done checking in. Morning breakfast was great with an assortment of coffee options, and happy hour in the evening was a welcome surprise. Close to everything in midtown. Closest subway station is a quick 5 minute walk for easy access to other areas of the city. Highly recommend, we will be back.

The 414 Hotel is wonderful. We live in the NYC suburbs and wanted to spend a few days in the city so we could see shows and do touristy things, and 414 was a perfect base. It's two blocks from the heart of the Broadway/Times Square area, and yet it's on a quiet block that feels as if it could be miles away. The hotel even has a beautiful courtyard between the two buildings to eat breakfast and happy hour snacks that really made us feel we were far from any city. And the owner (Susan) and her staff were so friendly and engaging that we felt like we were at a country inn. Finally, while our quiet, courtyard-facing room was pretty basic, it had a modern TV, a fridge with $1.00 snacks, and it was actually larger than many hotel rooms we've stayed at in NYC. I have told all our friends about 414, and will definitely stay there the next time we want to stay overnight in the city.

Sitting at JFK so thought I would post this before our flight. I booked this hotel a year ago based on reviews for our 6 night stay for myself, hubby and 7yr old daughter. Its a 22 room boutique hotel, your home away from home. Susan and her staff are amazing. I loved the newsletter each morning with the countries that guests are from and the tips. Susan and her staff know each guest by first name and happily assisted with each question and request. We had a room on the 4th floor but we were assisted with our luggage on arrival and departure. In fact, taking the 3 flights of stairs each time was very good exercise.Located very close to the theatre district and times square, really an awesome location. Laundry was a few doors down, and the owners of the laundry delivered our washing to the hotel, which was then delivered to to our room.A wine and cheese hour each night and a continental breakfast every morning. Lots of yoghurt, muffins, toast and tea and coffee. A good start to each day.We loved our room and the lovely new ac. A must for your stay in NYC. Thank you Susan and your team.

Great location near broadway. Close to everything we wanted, great hostess and staff. Feels like visiting family. Happy hour nightly, breakfast included, laundry that does great work a few doors down. We were personally recommended this place and it didn't dissapoint

I decided to book this hotel for my girlfriend's 50th birthday after reading some of the reviews. The hotel is conveniently placed close to many attractions. What makes this hotel different to others is the attention to detail and the excellent customer service by Susan and her team. I really loved the newsletter each day with suggestions of things to do.
