The personalized service (though "service" seems too cold a word) from Susan, Andrew, and all of the great staff, is like nothing I've ever encountered at a hotel. There's nothing they're not willing to help you with, from nearby (or not) restaurants, to things to do and how to get to them, to introducing folks to an app that works like Uber but whose cars are SUVs large enough for a small crowd. I have a special need regarding linens and they went out of their way to see that it was provided. Susan will spend as much time as necessary to see that you get what you need, from information to to creature comforts. The breakfast choices are wonderful, and there's a happy hour with a great assortment of whiskeys, bourbons, wine and cheeses. The rooms are spotless and lovely, the West Side location excellent, and most important, you'll not find a more attentive, caring staff anywhere.

We've only been here one night and one day, but Hotal 414 has to be one of the top hotels we've visited, anywhere! Susan, Jacqui and the rest of the team cannot do enough to make you feel welcome. From a greeting at the door about how your day was, to offers of cups of tea or coffee, to suggestions about what to see or what to do, and the best way to do it. Simply friendly service at its very best! All that, plus a convenient location in the theatre district, and a welcoming happy hour for guests with cheese and crackers and high-end wine and spirits. Great way to unwind at the end of the day. And to share experiemces with other guests. Cannot recommend it highly enough!

It was our first time in NY and I did extensive review of hotel accommodation (majority of hotels don't comprehend the concept of value for money - overly expensive for what they have to offer!). Truth be told, it took me about two weeks to review all the options and finally opt for 414. It was an excellent choice. Starting from organizing us a transfer from airport, swift check-in, everything was perfect. Room is excellent size, spacious for NY standards, super tide, great bathroom with all amenities you could actually need. We took a top floor standard room facing the 46th street, it is so peaceful - we slept with open windows! Residential area, safe, close to major sights, great metro connections, all around perfect choice. Susan and the team are doing amazing job, we couldn't recommend enough 414 - trust me, look no further - this is the best option in NY, when we're back in NY - this is the hotel we'll return, for sure!

From the initial booking to the trip to the airport, the personalized service that Susan and her team provided was 5 star! My wife and I, who were celebrating our 45th wedding anniversary, felt like we were family staying with a cousin in midtown NYC. Lots of good suggestions on what to see, where to eat and how to get around the city. Great location in a residential area and a quiet room. Many thanks for making our stay memorable!

Recently my wife and I spent six days here, first time under this management. What a difference! More like a 22-room B & B than a hotel. The manager, Susan, and her marvelous staff went way beyond our hospitality expectations. The included continental breakfast got every day off to a good start; the wine and cheese interval in the early evening provided a relaxing time to choose from one of the recommended restaurants on the available list. And really -- what hotel distributes it own daily newsletter!! 414 is well worth its top ten rating just for the unrelenting human touch.

Fantastic introduction to New York City.Susan and her team treated us like friends, not just guests. They took a genuine interest in us and would always go out of their way to give advise and suggestions.Guests were encouraged to socialise over breakfast and during the daily "cheese and wine happy hour".While Time Square and the Theatre District were within easy walking distance (10 minutes), the hotel is located on a relatively quiet street. Our room was clean and tidy, and our bed really comfortable. If you get the opportunity, join Susan's personal tour of Central Park.

We were so delighted with the 414 from the moment we walked in the door! Susan and her staff were over the top friendly and helpful. It felt more like a B and B with breakfast and happy hour each day.

I called the Hotel and wanted to send my brother a bottle of wine for his birthday while he is staying there. They were excellent with their communication and I was able to do exactly what I wanted. They were so nice and accommodating. Awesome Customer Sevice and Mary was so helpful!

This is a terrific small inn in a city full of mega-hotels. The rooms are great, the common spaces are awesome (there's an open courtyard in the middle of the hotel, plus some nice sidewalk seating along the street). I stayed for business, but I felt most people there were tourists. There's free happy hour in the afternoon and snacks all the time. Every time I walked through the lobby, whoever was working knew who I was, even if I'd never seem them before.What a pleasant experience. I'll be coming back!

I stayed at 414 with some friends, when we visited NYC. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. The room was very clean. 414 is a more residential area of NYC, which makes it a little quieter. Well quieter by NYC standards. I definitely recommend 414 to anyone looking for a cozy, warm and inviting hotel in NYC.

To Susan, Mary, Jacqui and all the staff thank you for a wonderful 8 nights in NYC and 414 Hotel. To have the owner of the boutique hotel at breakfast most mornings to help guests fine tune their day is unheard of in my experience. Susan quickly worked out what we were after and recommended a Blues club that was just what we were looking for and The Harlem Jazz Tour ...another awesome night. So many other tips and ideas to help us maximise our stay. The hotel itself is located centrally and only 5 mins walk to Times Sq. Rooms are lovely and the street quiet no street noise at all. Would highly recommend over the large hotels and will be recommending to all family and friends.

Room was perfectly fine: Clean, spacious (for NY), comfortable bed, quiet, had all the necessary amenities and everything was in working order. Exactly what you want if you are mainly only back at night to sleep or rest/change in the afternoon between touring around NY and you're not really looking for total luxury. However, the main reason to stay here is service, location, cost and the company. It was near everything, but still on a quiet residential street. The cost was so reasonable for being in the heart of Hell's Kitchen and right by the Theater District. The staff were super friendly and helpful. And in the afternoons, the hotel provided free drinks and we had such an enjoyable time meeting and talking to all the other guests from all over the world that were relaxing there before heading back out to shows/dinners/etc. Without a doubt, it was one of the most pleasant stays I've ever had in NYC and will book again there without hesitation. Do yourself a favor and consider it for your next trip.

Excellent boutique hotel for your NYC stay, it's close to Time Square & easy 40 minute walk to many of the must see places of the city & a couple of sub-ways are an easy walk away & good option, for those areas like, The Financial District that a considerable distance away. The accommodation is clean, comfortable & nicely decorated. Breakfast (which is included in the tariff) is a continental buffet style & quite nice. The staff are friendly & helpful with great advice on how to get around the city. An added bonus is being able to obtain the 'Big Bus Hop on/off' tickets at reception & a cost price. One suggestion I'd make when staying here & returning to the hotel after a day sight-seeing via the sub-way, is when you come out onto street level, you are usually on 7th or 8th Avenue. So if you're not keen to run the gauntlet of the congestion of crowds at Time Square, which is 24/7, try walking up to 9th Ave & to E46th Street & the hotel is just around the corner. Also, on the corner of 46th & 9th is a diner, serving excellent meals (highly recommend the pot roast) & on the opposite side of the road is a laundromat, where you can leave your laundry for collection later. They offer both machine dried & hung dried, the cost is very reasonable & worth the connivence. So when in NYC do what a lot of Aussies do & stay at 414 Hotel.

Absolutely amazing hotel from the moment my 7yo son and I arrived. We were greeted by Emmy who got us checked in, directions to the car park and a list of food and restaurant suggestions. Once in our room just off the courtyard, we found our clean and comfy room completely ready. Plenty of outlets and USB ports to be found because let's not forget the free wifi throughout the hotel along with the mini bar of sodas and snacks for just $1 each! YEH, in NYC!!Each morning we had a breakfast of assorted cereals, breads, juice, milk, coffee, tea and more. Each evening was a wonderful happy hour with wine and soda and a great time to sit and talk with other guests staying along with staff members Ike and Drew! Some of the best laughs were during those hours.Hell's Kitchen area is just blocks from Time Square, the Intrepid and tons of bars and restaurants. Not much further is Broadway and the Empire State Building just to name a few places. The street is residential so fairly quiet here but not hard to get a cab on either end of the street at 10th or 9th. I also felt completely safe walking around at night with my 7 yo son (like at 10-11 pm).I'm sure I'm missing so much but I will mention that as soon as we got home from our first trip to the 414 Hotel for Labor Day weekend, I booked another stay for Thanksgiving weekend! I can't wait to come back.

The hostess and staff could not have been nicer, or more helpful. Great location in a nice part of the city. Glad I checked TripAdvisor before my visit. I've recommended 414 to a number of friends and colleagues. I won't hesitate to return.

My stay in this wonderful hotel was magnificent, probably between the 3 best experiences I've had, very welcoming and very friendly staff, a concept very different from what we are used today, safe return.

My wife and I just spent 4 nights at the 414 at the end of August. Although I have been to NYC multiple times, my wife had never been. We went as an anniversary gift to ourselves. We were welcomed to our room with a note wishing us a Happy Anniversary, as well as a bottle of champagne and some chocolates! A very unexpected and appreciated surprise, but just the beginning of outstanding service in a city where such treatment is not the "norm". More on the service in a bit.Our room was very nice and VERY roomy by NYC standards. The bed was very comfortable and the room included a wall mounted TV and refrigerator. Was perfect for our needs.There was a continental breakfast each morning with a wide selection of very good breakfast food and drinks. Each evening, wine and cheese were served and was a great opportunity to meet some of the other hotel guests. The hotel does not look like a hotel from the street. It's in a very quiet neighborhood with brownstone apartment buildings, yet not a long walk to subways or Time Square. We had multiple people walking by ask us if this was really a hotel. We told them it was an amazing hotel, and highly recommended it.During our stay we met a half dozen of the staff and were extremely impressed with each and every one of them. They were VERY helpful with restaurant suggestions and advice on things to do and transportation, including maps and brochures. The level of customer care was a highlight of our trip. My wife is a big Dr. Pepper fan, but had gone a few days without one as the restaurants we went to didn't carry it. The 414 didn't either but, when one of the girls overheard my wife wishing she had one, she walked down to a store and bought one for her!! My wife and I were so impressed by this thoughtful, caring act.We were able to meet the owner, Susan, the day we left. Had a delightful conversation with her and found her to be very warm and friendly. We told her. How impressed we were with her staff and the accommodations and were recommending the 414 to all of our friends and family.I can't say enough good things about this hotel and would not hesitate going back or recommending to anyone with complete confidence.

My wife and I stayed here based off of the reviews we read - and I'm so glad we did. It's like a quiet little neighborhood place close enough to walk to the action. We especially liked the people who worked there; each had their own reasons for loving New York, and loved to share their stories. The staff is extremely helpful and I would call this as close as you can get (well - that I know of at least) to a bed and breakfast in the heart of NY. Would stay again and would recommend to first timers and even those returning - it was our second trip.

When you are searching a real, authentic, cosy and absolutely clean hotel you should book at 414. The employees are friendly, the recommendations are really good and can follow for sure. Price/Quality is top! In the middle of Manhattan you reach every place to be in a couple of minutes by foot.Thanks to 414, we will come back for sure!

I would give it more stars if I could. This is a gem in the heart of Manhattan not just because of its ideal location but more because of the excellent people. They are super helpful and friendly. This hotel is simple but comfortable. Cozy breakfasts and happy hours chatter make it feel welcoming and homey. It's on Restaurant Row with Greek, Italian, Brazilian, Irish, Egyptian, Spanish, Thai, Japanese and Chinese eateries just minutes away. The wonderful staff really made the week in NYC worthwhile for us. I hope we can return to NY again and again and I'm sure this will be our home away from home from now on. Loved it! Thank you Susan, Jackie and everyone else at 414 Hotel who made our New York experience unforgettable.

Quite large rooms for NYC. Right in the centre of the city but pretty quiet. Basic facilities but it's the people who make the difference. Nice idea to have happy hour if you want to meet and chat with other guests. Breakfast is ok but only cold hard boiled eggs and cereals. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed for 4 days in 414 Hotel and had a wonderful time. The hotel is located on 46th Street, only a few blocks from Time Square. Our room with a very good king size bed was good, also the bathroom. Susan and her husband Andrew are leading her hotel with a lot of engagement and motivation. Especially Susan is always open and friendly to support you or give recommendations. It was so nice chatting with her about all the sightseeing options you have in NYC. Beside this her staff is also very friendly and professional. Absolutely remarkable is the breakfast. We liked most the swiss coffee machine which offers all choice of coffee: cappuccino, espresso, café crema, etc. Having such a good coffee was always a great start into the day. Also the other stuff they offered was of excellent quality. And also remarkable, when you had finished breakfast you did not have any garbage on the table. Everything (except the butter :-)) was offered on plates, in cups or bottles. So significantly different than in other hotels offering self service breakfast. The hotel has a small patio and we loved it having our breakfast outside in the patio.So next time in NYC we definitively will stay again in 414 Hotel!

We enjoyed everything about this darling hotel. The room we had was nicely appointed and a nice size. I generally have sleep issues and a good bed is important to me. My daughter and I thought the bed was very comfortable. We had a refrigerator in our room stocked with a water and a few sodas. These only cost $1.00 each! It was also nice since we could bring a "doggie bag" home from dinner and keep the food for later. A continental style breakfast was complementary. They provided hard boiled eggs, yogurt, breads, muffins, bagels, cream cheese, cereal, granola, fruit, juice and milk, etc. The coffee was delicious! This alone saves you a lot but later in the day they provided a happy hour with complimentary wine, cheese and crackers complimentary as well. The special coffee machine was available in the lobby day and night along with a few snacks (yes, complimentary). Being in New York, security was important to us. This property has staff at the desk 24 hours a day to buzz you in. Awesome! Best of all Susan and the staff were so helpful and gave us lots of tips to make our visit better. For example we planned on walking the Brooklyn Bridge and they suggested we walk back instead. Why? Because of the better view! When we checked in the hotel provided us with a list of restaurants nearby. They only recommend restaurants they have tried themselves. We tried a couple of them and they were excellent! That was such a nice list to have because sometimes we were too tired to go far but wanted a lovely dining experience.There were people from all over the world staying in this hotel while we were there. This reminded us of the many small hotels we have enjoyed while in Europe. That is exactly what we had hoped for our trip! Can't wait to go back, but this time in the winter or fall so we can experience the fireplace in the lobby. BTW the subway is only 4 blocks away and you can get anywhere you want in NYC.

I stayed at 414 Hotel for a week with a group from Bay Area, we had the entire hotel so it was a bit like grown-up summer camp for theater groupies. So fun! The owners could not have been more gracious and accomodating, providing us with happy hour in evening and a full breakfast in morning, including lox and bagels on Sunday. The hotel is charming and comfortable, in a bustling westside neighborhood, a convenient walk to theaters, restaurants, subway and buses. I'd definitely return.Note: no elevators, be prepared for 4 walk-up floors.

The best in Hell's Kitchen! The staff is awesome, free breakfast with beautiful garden seating if you wish and wine in the evening. Sit out front and watch NYC on one if its coolest side streets off of 9th ave. Customer service is very important to me and these ladies are great. Maria wouldn't even let me make my own coffee! The little things do matter. Super location too, great hair salon across the street and tons of restaurants literally everywhere. Stay there and truly enjoy yourself!
user_name:
Juleonfoot
New York City, New York

review_body: Best little hotel in Manhattan. We can safely say that after our 5th stay at Hotel 414 we would not stay anywhere else while visiting NYC. The location is excellent and it is close to theatre and many great restaurants on Restaurant Row. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and very clean. One of the things we really enjoy is the great continental breakfast and visiting with all of the guests from other states and countries each morning and during the wine and cheese hour each evening. The staff and Manager (Susan) are kind, generous and very helpful with assistance and great suggestions.

Charming hotel, great staff, free lattes, free breakfast, free wine and cheese in the evening, safe, fantastic and picturesque midtown location, excellent price. I felt like I was visiting friends when we stayed here. This is not a luxurious hotel with pool, spa shops, etc. but it is a wonderful experience to stay here.

We spent 4 days in NY for our Wedding Anniversary, and couldn't have picked a better place! Centrally in Manhatten with an excellent hotel team that took great care of us! Thank you, Susan, and colleagues for making this a trip we'll never forget!Steven & Lisanne

We were here for a weekend trip as a small family of 3 to celebrate my wife's birthday. Our host Susan found out about the special day and left a very kind present along with a hand written card. Everything about the 414 is great. Susan and her staff are as warm and welcoming as the previous reviews say they are. Looking forward to our next trip back!

I was in NYC with my mom (first time she's been there) and wanted to be near Broadway for a show or two. I spent a while looking for the right place to stay and decided to go with 414 based on the high reviews on TripAdvisor. 414 was perfect; it has a BnB feel (community area with complimentary cheese/drinks/breakfast) with all the amenities of a hotel. As with most things related to travel, the people make the difference. Everyone who worked at 414 was truly lovely (not only helpful, but also great to talk to) and the other people staying in 414 were also great.Highly recommend. Favorite place I've stayed in NYC.

The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing, nice and helpful at all hours. Nice friendly environment during breakfast along with other guests. We will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

We have been to this hotel many times. Located very close to Broadway theaters. Best thing about the hotel is the owner, Susan, and her staff. Wonderful people who really care about the guests. Highly recommend it.

A few blocks from Times Square and the theater district you will find this extremely friendly hotel as your oasis. We had an excellent time. Everything wa clean, the daily happy hours were great to meet the other guests and chat with the staff. This place isn't fancy or pretentious, but it can be your home away from home when in Manhattan.

On a quick weekend trip, our family of three found 414 Hotel suited our needs perfectly as an intimate, international, welcoming home away from home. As other reviews (and the hotel's own website) indicate, this is not a fancy hotel. But what it lacks in luxuries it more than makes up for in its ideal location (nice walk to/from our theater show), cleanliness, decent room size (we had an extra cot placed in the room for our daughter after all), strong air con and shower pressure, good price point, and nice breakfast we enjoyed each morning in the hotel's lovely courtyard. What truly stands out, though, is the friendly professionalism of the staff: Emmy (whom we never met but helped over the phone with our initial reservation details), Michiko who welcomed us upon arrival, Drew who warmly greeted us on our return at night, Jacky who gave us detailed directions upon our departure for LaGuardia--and of course, through it all, Susan at breakfast each morning, looking after her guests attentively (and unobtrusively), with a genuine desire to help each visitor have a great day enjoying the city. When we get the chance to come back to New York, we'll be back at 414 Hotel!

We have stayed here twice and absolutely love it! I would recommend this hotel to anybody coming to New York. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is central location to mostly everything. Only a few blocks away is Times Square and the subway station. It is just steps away from restaurant row and Hell's Kitchen, so there are plenty of great places to eat nearby. If you are catching a show, it is a very close walk to all the theatres. The rooms are just what you need. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious. It comes with a mini fridge, which is always a plus! What I love most about staying here is the hospitality and the kindness of all of the staff. It truly feels like staying with family. Susan and her staff are wonderful! They really help you out with anything you need: restaurants to try, Broadway tickets, places to visit, any kind of advice you need they will help you with. They give you breakfast to get your day started, with things like muffins, bagels, hard boiled eggs, etc. Then, in the evening they have a 'happy hour' where you get wine and cheese. You get to meet lots of great people who are also staying in the hotel. I can't say enough about how much I love this place, we will certainly be staying here the next time we come.

We stayed at the 414 for four nights and we can only recommend it to anyone looking for the perfect location, an outstanding service and a clean, very comfortable room. It feels like coming home to family and friends after an exciting day in this vibrant city.

Finding a hotel that's 'just right' in the heart of a big city is a tricky quest, but we were lucky when we selected the 414 Hotel for our stay in New York. We were laughing as soon as we walked in the door, and included in an ongoing information/welcome chat from the staff member on duty. There's a kind of camaraderie at this hotel which is unusual - the staff and guests chat, encouraged by the details in the daily newssheet that tells you the weather outlook, ideas for sightseeing each day (e.g. what museums are free or what tours are going on) and even what nationalities the hotel is accommodating that day. They let you borrow stuff you forgot/couldn't bring (umbrellas, bikes and picnic blankets) that means you save a bit of money too.The hotel is small and on a quiet street in the middle of Manhattan, close to many sights and walkable to the nearest subway (about 3 or 4 blocks). We stayed in two rooms (we stayed on different occasions during our trip) and found each to be spacious (come on, how big a room do you expect for an urban megaville?) with a comfortable bed, aircon, fridge with snacks etc etc. If you need total quiet to sleep you might need to switch the aircon off at night. There's a good choice of continental breakfast options and a small kitchen you feel free to use if you need a drink etc. It's not fancy or luxurious (if that's what you're after you might want a more expensive option) but if you want friendly, clean, informative and not going to break the bank, consider this place.The staff were all well-trained, really friendly and helpful to guests - no weak links! Staff are on duty all night so you don't feel like you have to sneak in if you are out late :) There's no elevator but staff were always quick to offer to help with luggage so don't let that put you off. The most exceptional thing about the 414 Hotel was the way in which the staff are willing to help you plan any kind of excursion/trip during your stay. They don't just thrust a map at you like many other hotels, they ask what you are hoping to do, and suggest the best ways of getting there, what public transport to take, options for discounted tickets and even if the weather might affect your plans. It's judged well; they aren't nosey or too inquisitive, but offer genuinely helpful insider knowledge that improves your own plans. You have to watch yourself not to hog them all morning with your questions!Go! You will have a great time!

We had a great time exploring New York from this base. Breakfasts & Afternoon drinks were and enjoyable time to chat with other travellers and the team. We were referred by friends who had visited a month earlier. Susan and the team were fantastic, definitely contributed to a great NYC visit. When we visit next, we know where we will be staying.

Susan & Andrew with their fabulous fabulous staff have created our home away from home.We have We havestayed at Hotel 414 six times and look forward to the seventh . We enjoy meeting guests from all corners of the globe! Love walking to theater, hopping a subway to experience all of NYC glory. It is as though a guest has a personal concierge . Love the happy hour where guests a hare tips and experiences of the day..

Everything was perfect! Great service, attention to detail, clean, lovely employees, great continental breakfast & lovely wine and cheese break right before going out for the evening! Susan, the manager goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is all you hope for!

The customer service was amazing. The hotel is in a great location and we walked to several shows as well as a few top notch restaurants. It's also close to the Highline and we enjoyed walking it into Chelsea. The property is very well kept and safe. What stood out the most was the staff and how helpful they were. We will be returning!

My 10 year old daughter and I spent a mommy-daughter weekend in NYC this past July. We often go up for day trips, but this was the first time we stayed the night and I was looking for an interesting place to stay, close to Midtown, rather than a large impersonal hotel (even though some of those can be nice, too). After much research and checking out reviews, my top two choices came down to the French Quarter Apartments and 414 Hotel. They were both in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood, so close to Midtown but a bit off the beaten path, in a more residential, slightly worn area. 414 turned out to be a perfect fit for us - we didn't even mind the 3rd floor walk-up room we had, which was comfortable and clean, and the area is quieter at night than other parts of the city. The staff were wonderful and friendly, allowing us to drop our bags off in the morning before check-in, and keep them there the next day until we left for home later that afternoon. The breakfast was just right and it felt homey and comfy w/o feeling crowded. The owner showed my daughter some picture books about NYC and another staff member helped me figure out how to get down to the Lower East Side via subway. The night staff person was lovely and recommended a great take-out pizza place a few blocks away (Two Boots) because my daughter was too tired to go out for dinner. If you like interesting, intimate, and down-to-earth, then this is the place for you. If you prefer an elevator and a Midtown location, I'd suggest the Archer Hotel.

What a wonderful boutique hotel! We had the most fabulous time in New York and our hotel was just incredible! We felt like family from the moment we entered the hotel until the time we checked out. Over the top service from every single person that works for 414 Hotel. We were greeted each morning with a complimentary breakfast and each evening with a quaint happy hour. I think the happy hour might have turned my hubby into a wine lover! We really enjoyed the communal times. It was always nice to have conversations with different people and to hear what they had done that day or what they were going to do that day! Susan even helped us get a discount on Broadway show tickets! Perfect location to be able to get to Times Square or the subway. Perfect place to call "home" for a few days! We hope to go back to New York soon and this will be our hotel again! <3

We had a lovely stay at the 414hotel. The rooms are nice and well appointed. The location is terrific in a real neighbourhood, easy walking to Times Square, other attractions including the HighLine and NYC library(great tours), and close to transit. The staff at 414 are very nice, always helpful and welcoming, including the owner Susan who likes to meet her guests and provide lots of touring suggestions. The breakfasts are nice and convenient in the lobby or terrace, and the evening wine and cheese is a treat and chance to meet fellow visitors. We really enjoyed the small boutique feeling and being away from the crowds, and the more personal touches. Highly recommend.

414 Hotel, Susan, and her staff are the BEST EVER!! My fiancé and I were planning a visit to get married at City Hall and couldn’t get a phone or email response from the marriage bureau regarding the fact that we would need a witness as we were traveling alone. I contacted Susan at 414 to see if she had any info on this topic and without skipping a beat she offered to act as our witness in the event we could not access one at the marriage bureau. Seriously!? Have you ever been to a hotel where the owner/manager would offer to take part in your event or activity to ensure that it came off perfectly? Turns out we finally heard from the city that a witness could not be provided, and Susan did take time out of her busy schedule to travel to the Manhattan marriage bureau and act as our witness. She waited patiently as we worked our way through the process, provided her documentation, witnessed the ceremony, shed a tear of joy with us, took pictures, and hugged us both with the warmth and caring of the dearest of family members. She worked with me upfront on the planning, placing a beautiful flower bouquet in the room for our arrival, and surprised us with champagne when we returned after the ceremony. We watched each day as Susan and her staff took care of each and every guest as though they were a valued treasure. Susan gives each guest unrushed personal time, taking interest in them and their day’s events to ensure that anything she can do to improve their visit, is offered. Show reservations, recommendations on getting around the city, restaurants, sights, unique destinations, tours, coupons, you name it. Outstanding personal and professional services beyond anything we’ve experienced before. With the hotel being on a side street just off the busy areas it was warm and welcoming, feeling like we were coming home each day. Our room was perfect also. Quite large by NYC standards and toward the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard. It was extremely quiet. We never heard another voice, door slam, truck, car, siren, absolutely nothing the entire stay. We love the hotel and will stay there whenever we visit. But more important we love Susan and the extraordinary management of her hotel and guest experience. She is a treasure and we will be forever grateful for the amazing experience she provided for our very special visit to NYC.

Staying at 414 you feel more like visiting some friends rather than being at a l hotel, yet you benefit from being at a very good one. Cozy, comfortable, extremely good situation for tourism. We enjoyed all the advice from the employees and the management, the breakfast, the complimentary wine at 5pm. Very nice people, very enjoyable, we will repeat.
user_name:
cristinae360
San Juan de Alicante, Spain

review_body: We spent four days at the 414 Hotel last week and could not have been more satisfied with our stay! We were 1/2 block from restaurant row and less than 2 blocks from Times Square, but felt like we were in a charming, quiet neighborhood of Manhattan. People from many parts of the world were also guests and the management and staff welcomed us all like we were old friends. We were away from the hustle and bustle, and did not miss the impersonal feeling of a major chain hotel. The room, albeit small, was very clean and quiet and the bathroom was very spacious and all the amenities were provided. An ample breakfast and no-cost Happy Hour were also available to the guests. But what made our visit so special was the hospitality that greeted us, suggestions and recommendations made the trip very fulfilled and memorable. You will be very comfortable and happy with Susan and her staff.

The 414 Hotel is inventing a new and exciting concept of New York City hospitality. They hit a home run with our family. Last week my wife and our 11-year old grandson stayed at the 414 for a week. We enjoyed a quiet New York City neighborhood experience; were offered all the amenities of a much larger boutique hotel; and basked in the personalized and friendly service of a well-managed B&B. All of this was within three blocks of Times Square – and very affordable. What’s not to like?The rooms are on the second, third and fourth floors. There is no elevator but hotel staff will gladly assist you with luggage and other accommodations.They provided a small rollaway for our grandson; delivered a daily in-house newsletter that included travel info and the home countries of guests; provided an excellent breakfast and evening manager’s reception daily; and gave us a very complete list of excellent restaurants in the nearby area (46th Street is “Restaurant Row”) including 9th and 10th avenues.But the staff is the “secret sauce”. They are on duty 24/7 to meet your needs. They truly make you feel at home – in the neighborhood!The Trip Advisor system asks about modern, dry cleaning and concierge. We answered yes to all three because the concept is "modern", the dry cleaning is right next door and every staff person is a concierge.Tips: Use their interior courtyard to unwind; and there is a same day service Chinese laundry next door that will deliver to the 414 gratis.

We enjoyed our stay stay at 414 a lot! When we arrived, we were welcomed with a warm and friendly hello and a nice ice-cold Riesling. We loved everything at 414, especially the people (the very helpful staff and the guests). Every day started with a delicious breakfast and brilliant ideas and tips, that make you feel like a local. Many thanks to Susan and Andrew and Drew!

I had a very nice 3-day stay here. Clean and comfortable room, very friendly and helpful staff. And a very nice, free, quick and easy breakfast to get the day going quickly was a plus. Very convenient to the theater district. I would stay here again.

Great hotel with friendly staff. My two teenagers and myself shared a family room which was comfortable, the only niggle was that the AC was a little noisy but absolutely essential!We really enjoyed the wine and cheese before going out for the evening and the breakfast offered plenty of choice - the coffee machine was fab!The hotel is close to a wide choice of restaurants and the staff are very happy to give recommendations.Stay July 2016

This hotel provides genuine service from a great location. Human beings were always available to make a suggestion or provide a coffee cup. It was a very hot time of years but the A/C worked perfectly and the bathroom was a decent size. Highly recommended

We stayed here August 2016 it's a really friendly clean hotel . The staff where very helpful day and night. They made you a drink when you arrive back at night . It was like coming home. Much better than the big hotels. They booked tickets sorted out our flight and ordered taxis . We highly recommend this lovely quiet hotel. The Moffetts England.

I have never done a review on TripAdvisor before but this place was so fabulous that I just had to share! The entire staff is so friendly and welcoming. My husband and I came with very little planned and the staff was so great with giving us ideas on what to do around the city. They made reservations for us, got us discounted tickets to a jazz show, and even left me a little gift in the room when I told them it was my bday :) Special shout out to Andrew, Jacqui, and Emmy who were especially helpful during our trip! We saw so many things in NYC but I think what I'll remember and miss most is that wonderful hotel. Please consider staying here if you plan on visiting NYC!!

Great little hotel close to the theater district. Susan and staff will take good care of you to make sure you feel at home in NYC no matter where you are from. Breakfast and happy hour are included! Free use of bikes and umbrellas

Charming staff and outstanding service make this place #1! Susan, Andrew, Emmy, Jacqui & Drew really made this place stand out! They were always helpful with show ideas (even discounts), nearby restaurant recommendations (which we found to be wonderful), ideas of tours and other things to do, and transportation assistance. We chose the week of the hot and humid heat wave for our visit, but 414's lobby and our room were both refreshingly cool! Loved that!!!I don't think they're listed as a B&B, but they could be. Every morning they offer a plentiful do-it-yourself breakfast which included: bagels, toast, muffins, cereal, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, orange juice, coffee, cappuccinos and espressos. Every evening they offer a happy hour that included: cheese, crackers, a selection of wine and often times even several other kinds of spirits! The location was very convenient, just off restaurant row and not far of a walk to shows. And of course, the subway is nearby if you want to venture further. Thanks 414 Hotel for a great stay! And Thanks TripAdvisor fans for the recommendation! I'm passing it on!

This is a small boutique hotel on a quiet street within walking distance of Times Square, the theater district, and the Hudson River. I have never experienced such personal, helpful service anywhere, and I've stayed in many hotels in North America and Europe. The "Happy Hour" was an extra bonus! The staff helped me celebrate my 80th birthday.

I stayed here with my 16 years old daughter for 5 nights at the end of June. Hotel was very clean, simple but very comfortable. Great location near Times Square and everything but quite and safe. Staff was best I ever seen, welcoming, helpful and friendly.

Stayed here recently and had a great time. Staff are exceptional providing great advice and going to great lengths to ensure everyone enjoys their stay in New York. Great happy hour every evening to connect with other guests and share stories. Its located in central Manhattan just a few blocks away from Times Square/Broadway and close to the subway. Its not a 5 star hotel and does not pretend to be - its very clean and very comfortable with the most generous staff Ive ever found in a hotel.

We stayed at 414 for 6 nights this month. The main thing that sets this hotel apart (in my opinion) is the staff. Susan and the team, as previously mentioned in reviews, go way "above and beyond" for their guests. From advice about transport to booking Broadway tickets to making doctors appointments. I broke my arm in New York and Susan was extremely helpful in facilitating my access to medical assistance. Happy hour (or two) was a refreshing break from a busy day in the heat before venturing out for dinner or a show. The room was comfortable and clean, and breakfast fresh and adequate. Times Square, subway stations, theatres, numerous great bars and restaurants are close by. I would not hesitate to recommend 414 to anyone wanting a small, friendly, personal and well located place to stay in New York.

Base on the reviews I had high expectations. But being there is a regular B&B experience. The sink in the bathroom was dirty with a napkin inside, the remote control for the tv was shamelessly old and with visible signs of wearing. I didn't us the open bar option because of my schedule but I have to say that you notice that every one there try to be welcoming. Not a bad option but neither the best like the reviews seem to point.

Perfect location in west midtown, Near 2 subway stations. Really friendly and nice staff. Great Happy hour with wine and cheese.Breakfast is simple, but also good. We'll definitely recommend the 414 hotel to our friends and family.

We (couple) stayed here for 3 nights at the end of June. Susan and her staff were welcoming and so helpful - they are the real assets of the hotel. However, the great location, clean, comfortable rooms, open air courtyard, breakfast, wine and cheese "hour" and the perfect outside seat for people watching might have helped us enjoy our stay too. Believe all the good reviews people have left here, they're not exaggerating - this is a unique hotel, they really do care if their guests are happy and comfortable.

I found 414 Hotel when I googled "best hotels in New York" and, for the warmth of the welcome and for the way everyone went the extra mile to make our stay memorable, it would be very hard to beat. All the staff were great and provided really excellent customer service. Susan was incredibly helpful right from the time we booked, suggesting where we could watch a baseball game (Mets) on 4 July and offering to pick up theatre tickets for us. A special mention must go to Jacqui who really pulled out all the stops to help us find a dress for my daughter's university graduation - thank you Jacqui!As for the hotel itself, it certainly lived up to our expectations. The rooms were spotless and spacious, the beds really comfortable and the street surprisingly quiet for such a central location. The breakfast and the evening happy hour were really nice touches and an opportunity to meet other guests. I've never felt so welcome in a hotel and would heartily recommend 414. We will definitely be returning.

We spent 12 nights at the 414, which gave us plenty of time to give an objective assessment. Susan and her staff are wonderful, providing so much more then the normal service you would expect.They are so genuine in wanting to assist their guests have a great stay and went out of their way to offer friendly help and guidance,and we were so grateful for all their input.Our courtyard room was so quiet so we got the best sleeps and it was very comfortable. There is plenty of choice at breakfast and the evening wine/whiskey cheese and crackers are a great way to start the evening if you happen to be in between 5.30-7pm. The location is excellent, we walked to the theatres, restaurants and Times Square,Highline etc and the subway stations are close by. We will recommend this excellent boutique hotel to fellow travellers as Susan and all the staff really take pride in running an exceptional establishment! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

I stayed with my husband and six month baby, and I was very happy that I made the best choice ever to stay at the 414 Hotel. All of the employes and even Susan, the owner was very kind to me and my family. We felt like home... or even better, they all were very attentive to every detail and help us to have the best experience in New York. Located at the heart of NYC, in a quiet place near great restaurants and a few meters from Broadway and Central Park. The Room was comfortable and spacious and the breakfast great. A very special place with great sense of hospitality in a great location in NYC. Thank you all and I hope we can visit again soon.

Thanks to Susan and the team for making me so very welcome - they are just like family and it was nice they looked out for everyone and genuinely care, plus they love New York and it shows!I was travelling on my own from NZ and this was the perfect place to pick up tips and information, to connect with others over breakfastWeather was great/hotel very comfortable and wine and cheese a great touch and meeting place in eveningsWonderful hotel and city

A 22 room B&B on West 46th street that is convenient and specializes in hospitality. The staff is friendly and enjoys conversing with each guest. Regardless of shift, we were always greeted with interest. Genuinely warm and friendly, so you won't have to worry about feeling alone in NYC. There are 2 buildings that make up the inn, with a small courtyard between them. Our room was a modest size, clean and quiet with en suite bath. Breakfast from 7-10 is breads, yogurt and fruit and coffee/expresso/latte/cappuccino. Happy hour is 5-7 with wine, cheese, and fruit, a chance for everyone to meet. All meals are in the very front room, so there's plenty of pleasant comings and goings. During our stay there were 9 countries represented by the clients. It really is excellent.

Our one night stay was a wonderful experience. The staff were an absolute delight in every way. The happy hour was simply amazing. Breakfast was really good and varied and the breads and pastries and espresso were great (and it was served from 7AM until 11AM to accommodate all guests). The wifi was excellent. I actually looked for the label on the mattress so I could get one like it for our home and the linens and towels were delightful The room was spotless and absolutely quiet at night and the king bedded room was of excellent size by Manhattan standards. We would be unqualifiedly delighted to return and cannot recommend this little hotel highly enough. The 414 . The amenities and service were first class in every way also. This hotel has earned its superlative ranking in every way and the location is a gem too. I was a little leary about the lack of an elevator, but even an a not too enthusiastic stair climber (particularly on a really hot muggy day in July though it was entirely pleasantly well air conditioned inside) our 3rd floor room and the nice things associated with it and every thing else about the 414 made the stay more than worthwhile and memorable and we would eagerly do it again.

This is a fantastic place. It's not fancy so don't expect it to look like a W. The people working there make it. It's so personal and friendly, we felt welcomed like we were old friends without them being overbearing. Impeccably clean, simple, big rooms for NYC. It's on restaurant row and two blocks from Times Square but very quiet and homey.

I stay at 414 regularly. It is conveniently located, yet it is "exclusive" because the noise, the crowds, the bright lights are excluded. Open the red door, cross the threshold and the bustle disappears. Hospitality and sincerity are hallmarks of 414. Anticipate that you will be staying with guests from all around the globe. Relaxing and eating can be done at small tables, bistro sets in the courtyard, and on benches outdoors.There is a long community table in the reception/ meeting area that is my mainstay for fellowship and meals. This trip I sat with New Zealanders, French, Belgians, Canadians, Spanish, and English travelers. Delightful conversation and sharing the day occurs during "happy hour". Wines, juices, top shelf spirits, snacks and cheese choices enhance the convivial spirit. Room sizes are generous by NYC standards. There is nothing average about 414: Susan and her staff are superior.

What an amazing experience from the moment you walk in, you feel like you're home. We were greeted warmly upon our arrival and offered water immediately. They had just wrapped up breakfast but offered to take out something for us if we were hungry. Our room happened to be ready so we went and dropped off our stuff and were off. On our way out we met Susan who was so welcoming. Throughout our stay every staff member was kind and made conversation. The breakfast in the morning was simple but good and the happy hour was very social and had lots of options. The location is wonderful, so close to the theater district. The only thing was that there are only stairs, so if you have trouble climbing, this place may not be for you. Also, the rooms are cozy and a bit understated. The bed makes up for it tenfold though. My husband and I spent 3 nights here in the beginning of July and we will definitely be back to the 414.

This is not a normal hotel. Susan and the amazing staff (Jacqui, Mary, Drew, Emmy, Izi) make the 414 feel like home. The 414 staff truly want you to have a good time while in NYC and are always looking for ways to make your stay an enjoyable one. Susan went out of her way to get us last minute theatre tickets an hour before the play and her husband waited for us outside the theatre. They know each and every guest and encourage the guests to interact during breakfast and happy hour. The location is great, rooms are nice and breakfast was terrific. I highly recommend the 414!

Our party of five (3 adults, 2 kids) recently returned from five days in NYC at the 414 Hotel. It was our first trip to the city and without the amazing hospitality and guidance of the 414 staff, we would have been lost! Everyone was friendly and patient with our many questions and requests. The location of this hotel is perfect for theater goers. We went to six different theaters and it was an easy and safe walk to each. So many restaurants and bars are right around the corner too. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff is happy to help you with your luggage up and down the stairs.It was also a special delight to meet fellow travelers from all over the world during complimentary breakfast and the wine and cheese happy hour each afternoon.We will definitely return to this special place many times, I'm certain. A special shout-out to Emmy! She was the sweet, smiling face the first time we walked through the door after a long day of travel. She helped us immensely.

From the moment you walk through the door, you feel like you are being welcomed home. Your bags get whisked up to your room, and if you arrive early, they will hold bags, recommend a great lunch spot and have everything ready when you return. The rooms are immaculate, tastefully decorated, and spacious enough for comfort and relaxation. The breakfasts are more than expected; the relaxation hour from with adult beverages and cheeses all allow you to kick back, have pleasant conversation and enjoy. Susan knows the city well, provides off the beaten path suggestions and helps guests with tickets, transportation advice, and anything else she can do to make your stay a perfect experience. It is a quiet street but walking distances to theater and lots of excellent restaurants. The best combination for a city visit, whether you are coming from an international destination or the next state, you can do no better than the 414.

After reading all the great reviews on trip advisor, I was skeptical that this hotel would be that great. I was pleasantly surprised. The employees makes this the special place it is. They care about their guest experience not only in their hotel but in New York City, so they take care in recommending things to do and places to eat. What a treasure to find in such an ideal location. We will be back!

It's summer in the city so what better way to describe my stay at 414 as a good home base. The 414 is near the center of everything in NYC. The Metro is only for blocks away. The staff at 414 were very helpful. They were great at directions off course but they were more than that. They generally cared how your day was and if there was anything they could do to make it better. When ever I get back to NYC hope I can still get a room at the 414 after this. Shhss!

Great hotel near Times Square. Friendly and attentive service by every one at the hotel. We feel like we are at home. BEST place to stay in New York at reasonable prices. Excellent breakfast in the morning and happy jour is fun.

Well located with helpful staff. Comfortable, clean, and quiet . Great attention to good taste. Interesting array of guests from around the world who receive the best impression of US hospitality. More than adequate complimentary breakfast and happy hour . The location is a short walk to Times Square and the theater district and a stone's throw from restaurant row, yet couldn't be more removed from all of the hustle and bustle . There is a lovely garden . Reminds me of the delightful boutique hotels in Europe-- but with an American accent.

This must be the best hotel in New York! The location is perfect - 5 minutes walk to Times Square, and in very close proximity to some superb local restaurants. The hotel is spotlessly clean, with well appointed spacious rooms which are tastefully decorated. The owner (Susan) and staff (Jacqui, Mary, Drew, Emmy, Andrew et al) were tremendous - we felt like members of the family and the assistance given during our stay was outstanding, making us feel totally relaxed and providing us with significant savings on tickets to numerous attractions and the theatre. The evening Happy Hour provided a great opportunity to enjoy free whiskey, wine, cheese and crackers in the company of fellow guests, and we met some lovely people through this experience. Breakfast is a shared event with other guests, where one can enjoy a wide variety of food whilst discussing experiences and making plans for the day. We would highly recommend this hotel to anybody wishing a stay in New York for business or pleasure and we cannot praise this enough. Our grateful thanks to Susan and the team for making this such a memorable and perfect break 10/10 !!

This is a lovely small hotel built into a prewar brownstone in Hell's Kitchen which is easily within walking distance of the theater district but without the kitsch and tourist rip-offs found in that area. The staff was extremely hospitable and friendly. Breakfast in the morning and happy hour at 5pm were great time to meet other guests in the lobby. I would give 4 1/2 stars if possible. The only thing keeping it from five stars in my opinion is the somewhat basic condition of the rooms. Clean and safe but nothing attractive. However, the hotel is a great find and represents a great value in what can otherwise be an unaffordable city to visit. Highly recommended!

We've just had the most fabulous 6 night stay at the 414 Hotel NYC. I can't praise this hotel enough, from the owner Susan & her wonderful team, nothing was too much trouble for them & they were so helpful in giving advise & even issuing discounts on theatre tickets & the water taxi. The breakfast is more than continental, the room we had overlooking the courtyard was lovely & happy hour was fabulous with cheese/crackers & wine & spirits. We felt at home the moment we walked in, it was like staying with friends. I wholly recommend this hotel if you want a really lovely time near to all that NYC had to offer & people who genuinely care. We will not be staying anywhere else in future visits to NYC. Susan, carry on your good work, you are doing EVERYTHING right! Thank youMarie & Alan xx

The people and the quaintness of the hotel are simply wonderful. Everyone was so helpful, from places to eat, directions and even scheduled a Car to drive us to our next destination after leaving the city! My husband and I enjoyed our stay and loved being off the beating path but still so close to everything. (Waking distance) We will stay here on our next visit! Thank you Susan and gang!

it was our first time in u.s.a, we got there after a big ,4 weeks journey all around california, celebrating 40 years unniversary. when we got there, we have been a little tired of the trip and we felt like coming home.Every one was so friendly, tried and succeed to make us feel like home,susan helped us to get tickets for brodway show,juckui helped us to go with via through manhattan, she took us to the car more than 3 blocks away, anny was so pleasent all the time. we have gone to three days to niagra falls , susan told us to live our big suitcases in the room, and when we got back they were in our new room, in addition, susan made us spacial food for our first day of the trip. there are much more to tell, and i am very sorry because i dont remember the names of the the rest of the stuff bescause every one was wandeful.the room was very spacious and the bed is large and very comfortable.We recommended the place to all our friends and of course this is our hotel the next time in NYC

We have just returned from a US tour and stayed at the 414 at the beginning and end. I am having difficulty putting into words how good it is. If you like huge faceless chain hotels where you are just a number, then the 414 is not for you. If you like being treated as a special individual in a small, cosy and totally relaxing environment, then the 414 ticks all the boxes. As others have said, it does not get to be the No.1 Tripadvisor NYC hotel by chance. The whole team are a delight, so helpful, nothing too much trouble (the owner, Susan, even got me some tablets when I was under the weather, without being asked). Some of the restaurants they recommended were really great. The informal gatherings at breakfast & happy hour were lovely to share experiences/ideas. The room was fab, top floor, courtyard view, very quiet at night but so close to the action when required. There is a proper fridge, and all mini bar drinks/snacks are only $1 each !. It was truly like staying with friends, which is what Susan and the team became by the time we left. If we are ever in NYC again, there is only one place we will be staying, and that's the 414.

We are loving this cute little hotel! Perfect location, near everything but on a quiet part of the street. I could never say enough about the professionalism, helpfulness and knowledge of NYC of all the staff here! Thank you so much Mary, Jacqui, Susan and team! We are enjoying every second of our 5 years anniversary trip :)

We found the staff to be extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable. They made excellent restaurant suggestions based on our preferences and actually made the reservations for us. We were beginner subway users and their guidance helped us ride with ease. They genuinely enjoy their guests and getting to know them over a simple yet delicious continental breakfast.

The location is fantastic the staff were simply lovely, really helpful, friendly and full of really good recommendations. The hotel itself is great with 'happy hour' a brill time to meet other guests and share your stories and tips.

My wife and I were planning a short overnight to NYC for our 20th anniversary and I was looking for a niche hotel in the city. The reviews were good for 414 and it was as expected. It was a nice quiet spot in a bustling city. They had originally required a 2 day minimum stay but were nice enough to let us stay for one night for our anniversary. They treated us like family and we felt at home. We'll be back!
user_name:
Chris D
Cary, North Carolina, United States

review_body: This is a terrific hotel that not everyone will like. We didn't mind walking to our 3rd floor room (staff helped with our suitcases). We don't need a fancy lobby or a "scene". We loved our quiet room on an interior courtyard in the up- and coming- Hell's Kitchen neighborhood a few blocks from Times Square. We often stay in AirBnb apartments because we love having breakfast at our own time and without someone else coming in the room. The 414 kitchen on the 1st floor and great breakfast layout (until 11 AM) was perfect. Yogurt, fruit, milk and coffee was available all day long - a nice touch. OK, the hallways needed painting, but our room didn't. The a/c worked fine. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Wifi was strong and free. We walked home from the theater every night - a lovely way to end the evening. In short, the 414 had everything we needed. We'll be back.

From the moment we walked through the door we felt at home. Glass of wine in hand before we even checked in. This hotel may not be 5 star luxury , but it offers something far more important than that , a personal , friendly , joyous service. In a city where you will encounter rudeness on a daily basis the 414 staff provide an example of how all 'tourists' should be treated.The rooms are not luxurious but they are spacious and exceptionally clean. There is no 'lift' and we were on the 4th floor but really , it's no big deal , the staff will help if you need it.Breakfast was included and was very nice indeed. Fresh coffee on tap all day was really useful also.The cheese , wine and whiskey every evening provides a superb opportunity to chat with people from other countries .. We had an opportunity to inform more than one American that Wales is not part of England !!Location is perfect, 10 minutes to Times Square , restaurants on the doorstep and subway line close by. There is a bit of street noise but you are right on 9th Ave so this is to be expected.Overall a super hotel and we will return

This hotel is a true find on a quiet residential street. They serve breakfast and happy hour wine and cheese. It has an international flair with lots of out of country guests which adds to its great ambiance. It is just a few blocks from theaters, lots of restaurants and the thick of lots of action. It is easy to get anywhere from the hotel by subway, bus, Uber or really anything! The people at the hotel are super and extremely helpful and they learn everyone's name, giving it a nice personal touch. The staff have many suggestions for what to do and how to get there. The rooms are really nice and super clean. It's the kind of place where you don't mind leaving your door unlocked while you run down to breakfast. If you have dodgy knees I'd suggest booking on the first or second floor as the staircases are narrow and steep but the hotel staff are more than willing to carry luggage upstairs. I really enjoyed my stay and certainly will return!

Just one more time that I have been reminded why I love using Tripadvisor to find places to stay! For those like me who don't just go on the rating, but who actually read many of the comments that are made on each place, 414 is a boutique hotel located in mid-town NY. If you are looking for a 5-star, brand new hotel then this is not the place for you! The building itself has lots of character, quiet, comfortable and clean rooms and has good security in place to stop just anyone walking in from the street. What really makes this place is the people though. Nothing is too much trouble. We had most to do with Susan, the GM of the hotel and Emmy who were fantastic. Helped us arrange bookings of tickets to the baseball, tours around town, restaurant recommendations etc - the list goes on and on. Continental breakfast is included in the rate and it is a good chance to meet other like-minded travellers who are interested in meeting and chatting to people from all around the world. As I read and understood before going, there is no elevator but the staff were most willing to take your luggage upstairs if you couldn't do it yourself. Loved my time here and couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in NY.

We came to NYC to celebrate our 47 yr anniversary and were fortunate to book the 414 Hotel for four nights. My wife and I have stayed in hotels all over the US and Europe and this hotel rates up there with some of the best, it's on a quiet tree lined street away from the noise and crowds yet you are just minutes away from Times Sq and a lot of the popular sites Plus there are so many excellent restaurants in the area to choose from. The morning breakfast visits of fresh rolls and bagels, orange juice, fresh coffee, etc, more than enough to get your day going, the staff is very helpful with advice and discounts. We were in room 205, queen size bed that was so comfortable I could have slept in every morning but too many things to do and see, hop on hop off bus is a must do, Broadway is a very short walk with all the theaters to see a show, there is just so much to do and see here and staying at the 414 Hotel made our visit a memorable one, if and when we come back to NYC this will be our first choice of hotels to stay at, you will not be disappointed.There is a reason this hotel is so popular and highly rated and the staff works hard to see that you enjoy your stay, loved staying here.

Everything that you read in the reviews is true,homey,welcoming an oasis of calm after the hurly burly of NYC.The staff were very welcoming even bringing us a cup of tea to our room.The daily bulletins,were useful,the list of restaurants excellent,and booking cabs for us great.As two ladies travelling to New York for the first time it was an ideal place to stay,we will be recommending the 414 to our friends and hope to return in the near future.Loved the hotel loved New York.

Who says you can never go home? New York is home, although I haven't lived there in over 20 years. But now that I discovered 414 - home awaits and I can't wait to go back!Every little thing about this hotel is perfect - mostly the fabulous way you're treated the moment you walk in the door and throughout your stay. As for the rooms - well very appointed, spacious, great amenities, mini-bar treats for only $1 (!) and extremely comfortable. Susan and her staff dote on their guests - ask her something in passing or tell her something about your trip and she'll remember. Who does that?As a B&B owner in Israel, I was duly impressed by the level of professionalism, the comfort, the design - oh hell, I just loved everything there! I highly recommend the 414 - and encourage you to make it part of your New York experience.

My husband and I have been to many hotels and resorts with various star ratings, but nothing surpasses the hospitality of 414. I use the word hospitality because I heard someone make this distinction between service and hospitality. "Service is black and white and hospitality is color". Susan and the staff at 414 have mastered the art of hospitality, which is quite different than routine customer service. 414 is a unique property with loads of charm in a fabulous location. We were seeing a show and it was about a 10 minute walk to the theater. There are lots of great restaurants near by too. Once inside the hotel, it's easy to forget you're in a busy metropolitan area. It has a homey feel that is immediately soothing. Our room was quiet, clean and cozy. Breakfast was delightful with fresh fruit, bagels and cappuccino. And when was the last time the GM of a hotel sent you a personal email thanking you for staying with them? For the record, I have never taken the time to write a review, but was compelled to do one for 414. I am certain that if any problem were to arise, Susan and her staff would make things right. Bravo 414! You are now my go to hotel in NYC.

My wife and I normally stay at a chain hotel when visiting Manhattan, but we decided to look for something different on our most recent trip, which was part business, part pleasure. Are we glad we did! From the minute we walked in to 414Hotel (actually, even before that, when we called ahead), we could tell we were staying at a very unusual hotel, where the owners/management had set a genuinely welcoming, down-to-earth, gracious, just-say-yes tone that was so consistent throughout all of the people there (even the other guests…a self-selecting audience of likemindedness, I guess!). Many details had obviously been thought out and well attended to—the large, comfortable room with $1 water and snacks, the breakfast buffet (with good coffee), the generous wine time (w/bourbons, single malts, cheeses, etc). We also liked the block, which was a quiet oasis in midtown, our room, and our fire escape view of the church across the street very much.So thank you, Susan, Andrew, and staff for your hospitality. We will be back next time we head down to NYC!

Took my Mum to New York for her 75th Birthday and stayed at the 414 for a week. Perfect location - near restaurant row, theatres, Times Square and subways but in a leafy street opposite a church. Rooms are spotless, a good size, stylishly decorated, comfy bed and modern bathroom with a bath - good for soaking your feet after a hard days sightseeing. Breakfast is cereals, muffins, croissants, bagels, toast, yoghurts, cream cheese, jams etc, juice, tea and coffee - a good start to the day.Outdoor seating - a treat for a NY hotel. Sit out front and watch the world go by or in the courtyard out back.Best of all, the staff! Maps, routes, restaurant recommendations, unusual places to visit, best times to visit, what to pay for and what's FREE, check the subways are running, book theatre tickets, cabs etc, etc. I can't praise them enough, they made our trip stress free, in fact the made our trip.THANK YOU 414, hope to see you again next year

The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful. There were no elevators but a staff member was able to assist us with our luggage at check-in. Rooms were nice and clean and the complimentary breakfast, wine and cheese were a nice touch. It feels centrally located and close to many subways although we used Uber for the majority of our stay. Very close to Times Square. One morning, we even walked to Central Park. The hotel felt like a quiet retreat that is a few blocks from all the craziness of Times Square. Such cute place. Highly recommend it.

We had a fantastic stay at 414 Hotel, I would highly recommend this hotel. Location is perfect, staff is fantastic, Susan in particular whom I THINK is the owner , what a wonderful person . Felt like home away from home. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about 414. Ideal for leisure or business travel

This place is great. It is a half mile from Times Square, but on a quiet street, so it is quiet at night. The hosts and staff are wonderfully friendly. My room was super clean. The bed linens were soft and new. The bathrooms were updated and nice. I definitely will stay here again. -- Guest from NC

For those who prefer the small and unpretentious to the glossy and impersonal, this is the perfect choice. 414 is comfortable, relaxing, a place to meet interesting travellers, and above all to experience the warmth and kindness of the owners Susan and Andrew, and of their staff. Their ability to make each guest feel special, and to give personalised advice on how to make the most of a New York visit, was key to making our stay so enjoyable. The hotel is also brilliantly situated and we (in our mid seventies) were able to travel all over Manhattan on foot or using the subway - for which Susan's instructions were invaluable! We will take every opportunity to recommend 414 to our friends,

As always, it was a joy to return to Hotel 414 where Susan and Andrew and staff make me feel so welcome. For the first time I was put on the 4th floor, but they were very kind to carry my bags in both directions. Susan even helped me figure out how to book my first Uber ride! They have a tasty selection of breakfast treats available, and wines, cheeses, and assorted "harder" liquors ready for Happy Hour. Susan always has good suggestions for shows to see and places to go. There are fancier, more traditional hotels nearby, but this one is just right for me. Nice to meet friendly visitors from all over the world over breakfast or a glass of wine.

Warm, cozy, convenient and top notch personnel all conspire to make this the place to go in NYC. Can't go wrong. For a brownstone/small apartment-type building, it is also surprisingly quiet. And you get a very nice breakfast in the morning-that is unusual in NY.

My wife and I stayed at the 414 for most of a week and loved it. Rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Realize that there are no elevators so you'll be doing the stair-climber but the staff will help you with your bags. Speaking of the staff, they are the prime reason the 414 is so highly rated. They are like family when you arrive, during the more-than-adequate continental breakfast and at Happy Hour when they serve wine, cheese and a soothing assortment of scotch and bourbon. Their knowledge of where to go and how to get there was so valuable. You don't have to go searching for them... they are always right there. We will definitely stay at the 414 again if we visit Midtown Manhattan again.

This was my wife and I second stay at 414. A soon as we walked in I remembered why I couldn't wait to get back here. A beautiful charming boutique hotel in a great midtown location. The rooms are good size,comfortable and clean. They have a small courtyard out back where you can can enjoy your free breakfast buffet in the morning. (bagels,muffins, fruit ,cereal) and wine and cheese in the afternoon. You will never know your in midtown Manhattan What really sets this hotel apart from others is the staff. A more helpful friendly staff you will not find anywhere. The owner Susan does a fabulous job ensuring all your needs are met. she truly cares about her guests. It was a pleasure talking to her.My only regret is we couldn't spend more time here...but next time we will.Thanks again Susan and staff for a great stay!!!

The most convenient place we've ever stayed! We were made to feel so very welcome by everyone! Our room was large for New York! The fridge was stocked with refreshing drinks and there were various snacks, but not for your first born. Everything was crazy reasonable. Customer for life.

Daughter and I spent a few nights while visiting colleges. The location is, of course, fantastic and very central to everything, including a few blocks from the main theaters. But the real charm and plus of this lovely BB is that it is small, warm and staffed with very nice, friendly and helpful people. We enjoyed chatting with other guests and staff at breakfast. Staff made great recommendations and tips. Our room, one of the few with a split king bed, was small but it was very clean and comfortable. As frequent travelers in Europe, we generally prefer small BBs with owners that provide helpful info and a personal touch. We found that at 414 and already plan to go back.

This is my second stay at 414. Last time it was just me. It was during the first snow storm two years ago ( that never was). The owner Susan was amazing making sure everyone had what they needed, and even arranged a Yoga instructor to come the next day in case everyone was snowbound and stare crazy. :)This this time my husband joined me. He's not a traveler, can't handle noise, has allergies, and sleep issues. He is hooked now as am I about 414. We won't stay anywhere else. EVER!The rooms are large for NY, simple but beautifully done, impeccably clean and appointed. The front desk staff and owners cannot do enough for you. The breakfasts are lovely and the guests are interactive and friendly. We had the best wine , cheese and other beverage choices at 5:30 p every evening before the shows, then had a light bite afterwards at the Thai restaurant a half a block away.I highly recommend this hotel for single travelers too. You have all the privacy you want but also know that you can ask for anything you need, including a bit of company if you want for the breakfast and wine and cheese times. They are extremely helpful with recommendations for restaurants, dinner, shows, how to get around New York, what not to miss while you are in the great city, and tips on where to shop or find things you want to bring home.  Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!

I met my friend in New York and we spent one week at the 414 Hotel. We had a great time! The room was a decent size, the beds were comfy, the staff super friendly and the location is absolutely great. Of course, it's downtown New York and it might be noisier than at home - if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room in the back-building. But the breakfast and apero are superb and I hope to be back in New York at the 414 soon again!

I have been staying at this small boutique hotel for the past 5 years (3 times a year). About 2 years ago, Susan and Andrew Katz purchased the hotel and they have made many improvements: rooms have been renovated, good wifi in all rooms, excellent continental breakfast, wine and cheese at 5:00PM, and new espresso machine. The staff is very attentive your needs from carying luggage to your room (4 floors and no elevators) to helping with directions and restaurant recommendations / reservations. The rooms are neat and clean, recently carpeted and freshly painted. Staying at 414 is just delightful and price is very reasonable for theater district in NYC. I highly recommend you give it a try.

It was if we came home. Very friendly people. Good room. Clean. It's a little hotel with good breakfast. Good service. The happy hour is good. You can get ideas for trips from other people. When we go back To New York, we would like to stay again in this hotel.

Our stay at the 414 Hotel was a true delight from start to finish. The hotel is very well located, close to tourist attractions and great restaurants / bars. It is also very well placed with regards to public transportation. The hotel itself is very charming, clean, very good sized room, perfectly working Wifi, wonderful service, excellent hospitality and warm and welcoming. The breakfast service (hot and cold choices) and happy hour in the afternoon are both great! I would recommend this hotel to anybody, and we will definitely be coming back soon again. Susan and her team are wonderful!

An excellent small and very friendly hotel. Wonderful location and the comfort and cleanliness of the room was first class.The owner Susan and staff, went far and beyond with the helpful advice for our first NY visit. We will use this hotel the next time we are in NY.
